If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Venus' Group

texts.en:
Venus lives in Mian Channu which is a small city located in Punjab province, Pakistan, known for its agriculture industry. She married I. M. 23 years ago. Since then she has been living in a 2-room brick house in  Mian Channu. Her husband is involved in an animal sales business. He raises animals (goats), and then sells them to his customers. He has been in this line of work for the past 10 years and now manages to have a good number of customers. 

Venus has given birth to three sons and two daughters. Her two younger children are getting their education while her elder ones left their education after completing their matriculation. Now her eldest son works as a salesman in a soap manufacturing company. Her elder daughter is a nurse while the 2nd one does sewing for neighborhood clients. 

Venus has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to improve her husband’s business. With the loan, he will purchase some goats to sell at a profit. Venus is very hopeful about the positive growth of her husband’s business and about the better financial future of her family. 

She is a new loan applicant of Asasah and hopes it will be a profitable experience for her.

loans.use: To buy goats for resale

loans.name: Claudia Patricia

texts.es: La Sra. Claudia Patricia E. A. ella es trabajadora activa de la Empresa Hotel Barceló Monte limar  desempeñándose como Camarera tiene  seis años  de trabajar para esta institución  tiene un hijo en edad escolar. Ha tenido  dos créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno los ha realizado para la compra de materiales de construcción como Arena, Cemento, Piedra, Piedrín, Bloques etc.  Para ampliar y mejorar su casa de habitación, los cuales los créditos con ceprodel le ha beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esta manera ella ha  mejorado su condición de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en: Señora Claudia Patricia E. A. has been working in housekeeping for the Barceló Montelimar Hotel for 6 years.  She has one school age child.  She has had two loans with CEPRODEL that she has used for the purchase of construction materials such as sand, cement, stone, gravel, blocks, etc., to expand and improve her home.  She has benefited greatly from the CEPRODEL loans as they have helped to improve the living conditions of her and her family.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials such as sand, cement, stone, gravel, blocks, etc.

loans.name: Felisa

texts.en:
Felisa is a 59-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating three business ventures: buying & selling herbal products, tricycle transportation and farming. She lives in Sta. Catalina, Negros Oriental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2002 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 5,000. Felisa is borrowing PHP 15,000 to purchase more stocks to sell. This will be her 18th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 15,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Felisa aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team - http://www.kiva.org/team/nwtf_philippines on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: As additional working capital

loans.name: Judy Njeri

texts.en:
Judy is a 41-year old single mother of three children, aged 12, 10 and 7 years. She has been keeping livestock on her own piece of land and selling them later at a profit.   She has been doing this for 18 years, with an income of approximately KES.10,000 per  month.


This is her first loan from KADET LTD., and she intends to use it to buy animal feed and farm inputs. She hopes to expand her business by buying a dairy cow for milk production in order to help her improve the living standard of her family and give her children a quality education.

loans.use: To buy animal feed and farm inputs

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann works hard to support her two children. Mary Ann is a married woman and has a general store business in the Philippines. Mary Ann has been in this business for three years.  

Mary Ann requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy merchandise to sell in her general store.

In the future, Mary Ann would like to put up a livestock business.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise to sell in her general store

loans.name: Roberto

texts.en:
Roberto P. is from the village of Mabuhay, Valencia City. He is 33 years old, married and has 4 school-aged children. Roberto owns and operates a business providing motorela or habal-habal (motorcycles with extended seating) transportation services to local community members. Roberto has been engaged in his business for over 3 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2011, Roberto joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Roberto is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase tools needed to maintain service. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Roberto from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase tools needed to maintain service

loans.name: Haydee

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN MARTIN DE ZURITE”; Este banco está ubicado en el Poblado de Zurite,  provincia de Anta y  departamento de Cusco.

La Sra. Haydee, es casada y tiene 45 años de edad,  tiene 3 hijos de 25,24,14 años de edad la socia tiene un pequeño kiosco escolar en la escuela fiscal de Zurite, la socia vende desde galletas y todo tipo de golosinas hasta bebidas frías, la socia mantiene su kiosco surtido y siempre tiene lo que a los niños les gusta, ella también vende sándwich de pollo, jamón, queso y huevo; ella también se dedica a la crianza de animales menores, la socia cría chanchos, cuyes y los vende en las ferias al por mayor, la socia es una mujer muy trabajadora y apoya en los estudios a sus hijos. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de animales menores y comprar golosinas, bebidas e implementar su kiosco escolar.

La socia valora y agradece el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas de forma disciplinada.
texts.en:
The associate, Ms Haydee, belongs to the communal bank "SAN MARTIN Zurita" located in the Town of Zurite, Anta province and department of Cusco.

Ms. Haydee is married, 45 years old and has 3 children aged 25,24,14.  She has a small kiosk in the tax school Zurite, where she sells everything from cookies and all sorts of goodies to cold drinks.  She, keeps the kiosk stocked and always has what the kids like, including sandwiches of chicken , ham, cheese and eggs.  The associate is also engaged in raising small animals, such as pigs and guinea pigs and sells them wholesale at trade fairs.

She is a hard-working woman and supports the studies of her children. The associate requests the loan to buy small animals as well as to buy sweets and drinks for her school kiosk.

She values ​​and appreciates the loan and agrees to comply with the payment of its debts in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: buy small animals as well as to buy sweets and drinks for her school kiosk.

loans.name: Hefseba Group

texts.en:
Patricia M. is married with one son who is still at school.  She has been operating a general store  since 2008. She works from 6.30am to 10.00pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Patricia's second "motisha" loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  A "Motisha" loan is a product offered by Tujijenge Tanzania that allows borrowers with good credit ratings to pay back their original loans faster and receive extra money before their original loan term has ended. She used the previous loan to increase the store's stock and has paid back her loan successfully.  She wants a loan to further increase the general store inventory. Her dream is to one day own a big store and sell at wholesale prices as well.

Patricia will share this loan with her loan group "Hefseba" which has a total of 11 members.  The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

In the picture, Patricia is 1st on the left just near the palm tree, in a white dress.

loans.use: To increase the shop inventory.

loans.name: Antonina

texts.en:
Antonina is from the village of Dinas, Sinacaban, Mis. Occ. She is 63 years old, married and has four adult-aged children. To make a living, Antonina runs a business venture in the retail sector running a general store and selling a variety of different products in the local community.

Antonina has been engaged in her business for 15 years and earns approximately 1500 PHP a month for these activities. Antonina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. 

Antonina is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP with which she will purchase variety of products such as shampoo, toothpaste and soap etc. for her general store. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Antonina from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of products such as shampoo, toothpaste, soap etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Prossy

texts.en:
Prossy is 38 years old. She is single and has four children, all of whom are currently in school. Prossy has a restaurant business, which she has run for ten years.         
To help expand her business, Prossy has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Shillings from Kiva partner, BRAC. The loan will be used to purchase more food to cook in the restaurant. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Prossy hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. In the future, she hopes to expand her business further.

loans.use: to purchase more food to cook in her restaurant.

loans.name: Josefa Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Josefa , es habitante del municipio  de Ticuantepe , junto a su esposo e hijos , los planes hacia un futuro es poder brindarle una mejor condición de vida , doña Josefa desde hace varios años se dedica al comercio , la mayor afectación que se le presenta son las alzas de productos , Agradece el apoyo que le brinda Afodenic atrávez de fondo Kiva ya que con ello logro ampliar su negocio  antes solo vendía frutas y verduras y ahora se amplió a vender comida rápida , golosinas , gaseosa , etec.
texts.en: Josefa lives in the municipality of Ticuantepe together with her husband and children. Her plan for the future is to provide them with a better quality of life. Josefa has been a merchant for several years. Her greatest challenge is the increase in the price of products. She is thankful for the support provided by Afodenic (Kiva Field Partner) funded through Kiva. It was with their help that she managed to expand her business. Previously she only sold fruits and vegetables and now she also sells fast foods, snacks, soft drinks, etc.

loans.use: to purchase sweets, soft drinks, fruits, etc.

loans.name: Raya

texts.en:
Raya is a married woman with six children, all of whom graduated from school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and hospital bills. 

For the past four years, Raya has operated a poultry business, selling from home to butchers and restaurants. She faces major challenges regarding the high cost of transporting chicks and the lack of a ready market. Raya dreams of expanding her business to rear both broilers and layers. 

Raya plans to use this KES 20,000 loan to renovate her chicken stall and purchase more chicks. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To renovate her chicken stall and purchase more chicks.

loans.name: Silvia Maria

texts.es: Silvia Maria su actividad es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más 23 años que tiene este negocio. Ella está muy contenta por eso recurre a su crédito, con el cual comprará mercancías variada a un mayor volumen, que le permita obtener descuentos y ofrecerle buenos precios a sus clientes para seguir posicionándose en el sector. Silvia se siente muy agradecida por vivir todos los días y tener un trabajo que le ayude a sufragar los gastos del hogar. Con el crédito comprara sabanas, ropa en general, calzado y cosméticos.
texts.en: Silvia Maria has been selling general merchandise for 23 years.  She is happy to be able to use the loan to buy greater volumes of varied merchandise, at discount cost, so she can offer better prices to customers.  This will help her gain a better market position within her sector.  Silvia gives thanks each day just for being alive and having a job that allows her to cover household expenses.  With the loan she plans to buy sheets, general clothing, shoes and cosmetics.

loans.use: To buy sheets, clothing, shoes and cosmetics.

loans.name: Vera

texts.ru:
Вера  - 58-летняя фермерша, живущая со своей семьей в селе Тюп. В 1991 году Вера начала свой бизнес в разведении бычков, кроликов и свиней с начальной суммой в 15,000 сом (KGS).  На сегодняшний день, ферма Веры дает ежемесячную прибыль в сумме около 13.000 сом (KGS). Благодаря своему бизнесу, Вера смогла провести свадьбу сына и помогла ему купить машину для молодой семьи. Для дальнейшего расширения бизнеса, Вера обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) для покупки одного бычка и шести поросят для откорма и последующей перепродажи.  На доходы она планирует приобрести необходимые для проведения ремонта дома стройматериалы.  
ЗАО МФК "Бай-Тушум и Партнеры" предоставляет кредиты по линии Кива для социально-уязвимых слоев населения. ЗАО МФК "Бай-Тушум и Партнеры" является одной из лидирующих Микрофинансовых организаций Кыргызстана. "Бай-Тушум и Партнеры" – это надежный финансовый партнер, осуществляющий вклад в развитие экономики Кыргызской Республики путем предоставления доступных микрофинансовых услуг в сельской местности и городах, способствующих созданию рабочих мест и отвечающий интересам своих клиентов и инвесторов.
texts.en:
Vera is a 58 year old farmer who lives with her family in the village of Tuyp. In 1991 Vera started her own business by breeding calves, rabbits and pigs with the starting capital of 15,000 KGS. Today Vera's farm gives her a monthly profit of around 13,000 KGS. Thanks to her business Vera was able to throw a wedding for her son and helped him buy a car for his young family. For the further growth of business Vera has come to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan in the amount of 30,000 KGS to buy one calf and six piglets for feeding and selling afterwards. She plans to use the income to buy the necessary building materials for making repairs in her home.

ZAO MFK Bai Tushum & Partners provides loans through Kiva for socially vulnerable population regions. ZAO MFK Bai Tushum & Partners is one of the leading micro financing organizations in Kyrgyzstan. Bai Tushum & Partners is a reliable financial partner which makes an impact in development of the economy in the Republic of Kyrgyzstan, provides affordable micro lending services in the rural towns and cities, helps to create jobs and is responsible for the interests of their clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Lonlongnon Group

texts.fr: Le groupe LONLONGNON est formé de trois personnes qui vivent dans le même quartier. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Davigan, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la troisième fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Davigan est mariée à un menuisier du nom de Adam. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés. Davigan vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les différentes charges de la famille sont supportées de façon conjointe par Davigan et son mari. Il y a près de seize ans que Davigan mène comme activité, la vente de produits divers (condiments de sauce, conserves, huile de palme, etc.) dans son quartier. Davigan s’approvisionne au Bénin. Dans le but d’augmenter le stock de ses produits et de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle, Davigan désire obtenir un autre crédit auprès de ALIDé, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe LONLONGNON.
texts.en:
The LONLONGNON group is made up of 3 people who live in the same area. Davigan, the group's leader, is the one in the picture with her hand raised. The group is applying for a third loan from ALIDé in order to increase their business activity.
Davigan is married to Adam, a carpenter. The couple live together with their 3 children, who are all in school. Davigan and Adam both contribute to their family's upkeep. Davigan has been selling staple goods (condiments, canned goods, palm oil, etc.) in her area for nearly 16 years. She gets her supplies in Benin. In order to increase stock to meet customer demand, Davigan is requesting this new loan, together with the LONLONGNON group.

loans.use: to buy boxes of canned goods and condiments (tomatoes, peppers, palm oil, etc.)

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
La señora Yolanda tiene la edad de 24 años, estudio la preparatoria, esta casada con el señor Gilberto que trabaja de obrero, ellos tiene 2 hijos que se encuentran estudiando.ell avive en una region cañera.

Ella nos platica que desde hace unos años decidio iniciar con su propio negocio de venta de desayudos, porque dice que la situacion economica cada vez es mas dificil y piensa que debe ayudar a su esposo con los gasto del hogar y la educacion de sus hijos.

Doña Yolanda nos platica que su esposo trabaja en el ingenio y que ella todos los dias le manda su lonche algunas veces su esposo compartia su comida con sus compañeros que no les ponian desayuno y como les gusto mucho los guisos y el sazon que le daba su esposa a la comida iniciar a pagar a doña yolando por enviarles desayuno y desde entonces vende desayunos y almuerzos a los emprleados del ingenio, ella se encuentra muy feliz porque gracias e ello gana un poco de dinero extra haciendo lo que mas le gusta cocinar.

Ella necesita este prestamo para la compra de huevos, queso, frijoles, arroz, naranjas, melon, platanos, carne, pasta de mole, tortillas, vasos de platicos y vasos para posteriormente realizar sus alimentos.

Doña Yolante espera que con esta inversion pueda en un futuro tener local para poder alli poner su desayunador y asi su negocio cresca.
texts.en:
Señora Yolanda is 24 years old. She attended high school. She is married to Señor Gilberto, who works as a laborer. They have two children, who are in school. They live in a sugar cane producing region.

She tells us that a few years ago she decided to set up her own business selling breakfasts, because she says that the economic situation is more and more difficult and she thinks that she should help her husband with the household expenses and the education of their children.

Doña Yolanda tells us that her husband works in the sugar mill and that every day she sends him his lunch. Sometimes her husband shared his food with his fellow workers who did not have breakfast, and as they very much liked the dishes and the seasoning that she gave to the food, they began to pay Doña Yolanda to send them breakfast. Since then, she has sold breakfasts and lunches to the employees of the sugar mill. She is very happy because, thanks to this, she earns a little extra money doing what she most likes to do -- cook.

She needs this loan to buy eggs, cheese, beans, rice, oranges, melons, bananas, meat, mole sauce, tortillas, plastic cups, and glasses to prepare her foods.

Doña Yolanda hopes that with this loan she can in the future have a shop where she can set up her breakfast room and thus her business will grow.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to prepare breakfasts to sell.

loans.name: Cristo Salva 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Esperanza is the coordinator of the Cristo Salva Groups 1, 2 & 3. Her family is maD. up of four children and a husband. She said that her most difficult challenge is to proviD. a better future for her children by working hard selling in the street. She wants to improve her business and give her children the opportunity to live safe, tranquil lives with as little need as possible.

Esperanza is very excited to receive her third loan through Esperanza International. She took her first loan almost two years ago, and she is very grateful for the opportunity her neighbors gave herself by inviting her to join the group. 

She has had her business for about 22 years. She started by selling silver jewelry such as rings and chains, using money that she had saved up. Esperanza is planning to invest by purchasing underwear and clothes for men, women and children.

She will use her business profits to reinvest and expand her inventory by buying more products, planning to set a little miscellaneous store in her house. Esperanza dreams of having a beautiful house and a successful business. 

This group is composed of 15 Haitian's immigrants, located in the city of La Romana, where tourists and the sugar cane are the biggest industries. They all live in a rural area called Batey, surrounded by sugar cane fields.

loans.use: to buy underwear and clothing.

loans.name: Fred

texts.en:
Fred is 32 years old with three children and lives in his own house in Kagadi, Uganda. He has been in the produce business for 4 years and business is still feasible.

Fred faces a challenge of limited capital to purchase enough supplies. His dream is to set up a maize and beans store that can supply the western part of the country. He wants the money to buy maize and beans to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize and beans to sell.

loans.name: Celso

texts.es: El señor Celso, trabaja  como chofer y su esposa es comerciante. El crédito lo requiere para la instalación  de gas a domicilio que se está realizando en su barrio. Vive en casa propia ubicada en la zona San Pedro  de la ciudad de La Paz; es casado y tiene dos hijos. El cliente se encuentra muy satisfecho con os créditos que se le otorgaron anteriormente ya que pudo mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. Esta es la primera vez que su crédito es canalizado a través de Kiva.
texts.en:
Sr. Celso works as a chauffeur and his wife is a merchant. The loan he is requesting will be used to install a gas connection in his home since this utility work is being performed in his neighborhood. Celso lives in his own home in the District of San Pedro in the city of La Paz. He is married and has two children.

Celso is very satisfied with the loans he received previously since they have helped to improve his family’s quality of life. This is the first time his loan is being referred to Kiva for funding.

loans.use: to pay for the installation of a gas connection to his house.

loans.name: Jeannette

texts.en: Jeannette is single and owns a small shop that offers tailoring and clothes alterations. She has been running this business for 2 years. She would like the loan to buy new fabrics to offer to her clients. She will be able to establish more business and increase her savings with the profits. She would like to see her business expand and prosper.

loans.use: To buy more fabrics and use them in making clothes for her customers.

loans.name: Irlanda Marilux

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal 20 De Abril se reúne cada 15 días en el Cantón Montecristi (Portoviejo), conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar vive la señora Irlanda,  tiene 59 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos los mismos que ya son mayores de edad, uno de ellos aun vive en su casa. El marido es comerciante.
 
Ella es maestra en una escuela de la localidad pero adema de esto ella también se dedica al comercio, vede ropa y productos de Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja todos los  días ya que de lunes a viernes trabaja en la escuela y los fines de semana se dedican a vender sus productos, ella deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada quince días, también vende en su lugar de trabajo. Tiene seis años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y ropa de todo tipo. Este es el tercer ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque la unión que hay en el grupo. 

Su sueño tener una boutique.
texts.en:
The "20 de Abril" communal bank meets every two weeks in Montecristi canton in Portoviejo province, which is known for its rich pre-colonial culture, and for its handicafts, which are recognized at the national and international level. This is the home of the famous toquilla straw hats (also known as Panama hats).

This is the place where Irlanda lives. She is 59 years old, and is in a common-law relationship. They have three children, three of them adults, and one still living at home. Her husband is a shopkeeper. She is a teacher in the local school, but in addition to this, she also has a business selling clothing and Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume, and ladies' accessories). 

She works every day, since from Monday to Friday she works at the school, and on weekends she sells her products. She sells her products on credit, and collects every two weeks. She also sells in her workplace. She has been doing this for six years, and it's going very well. This loan is to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics, and clothing of every kind. 

This is her third loan cycle with the communal bank, and she likes it because of the unity in the group. Her dream is to have a boutique.

loans.use: To buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics and clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase goods for her store

loans.name: Lucrecia Evangelina

texts.es: La señora Lucrecia es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora quien inicio hace 6 años su pequeño y modesto taller de costura y bordados cotonas, trajes y blusas  entre otros. Ella invertirá el crédito en materia prima manta, crochet, accesorios, adornos…etc.
texts.en: Lucrecia is a hardworking, entrepreneurial woman who began her small and modest sewing workshop (embroidery, cotton shirts, suits, blouses, etc.) 6 years ago. She will invest the loan in raw material, crochet, accessories, decorations, etc.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, etc.

loans.name: Shikhwenyi Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Shikhwenyi Group in Western Kenya! Harun is the facilitator of the group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. 

Harun takes care of four children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Harun had a good maize yield, harvesting 14 bags on 3/4 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, he was only able to harvest 4 bags of maize on 3/4 acre of land. 

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Harun and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance. 

With income from maize sales, Harun will ensure food security and invest in livestock rearing.

 In 2012, the members of Shikhwenyi group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Felicita

texts.es:
Felicita, de 28 años es una mujer alegre. Vive en compañía de Nilo, su esposo desde hace 8 años. Ambos tienen un hijo: Josep al que cuidan en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Aymará. Como buena mujer del campo, ella se dedica a las labores de la agricultura, mientras que su esposo se dedica al oficio de albañil, pues le deja mejores ganancias. Los principales sembríos que produce son papa, olluco y oca. Los cuales después de cada cosecha, lo comercializa en la ciudad de Huancayo al menudeo, así ella misma obtiene mayores ganancias. Además de cuidar a sus cerdos y ovejas que posee; los cuales cuida y alimenta con el objetivo de engordarlos y venderlos a un mayor precio. Según cuenta, en temporada de escasez económica, la venta de sus animales le ayuda a mantener los gastos familiares. Ahora su principal objetivo es mejorar la infraestructura de su vivienda. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “Aymara” y este es el primer crédito con MFP, por lo que se siente desarrollada, ya que recibirá la ayuda económica que necesita para lograr sus objetivos. Por ello promete ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas. 
Felicita de recibir su apoyo; invertirá en la compra de fertilizantes naturales para mejorar sus sembríos.
texts.en: Felicita is 28 years old and a happy woman. She lives with Nilo, her husband of 8 years. They have a child Josep who they take care of in their own house, located in the village of Aymara. Like any good rural woman, she works in agriculture while her husband is a bricklayer as it gives him better returns. The main crops she plants are potatoes, oca and olluco (both Andean types of tubers) which she sells retail after the harvest in the city of Huancayo as it gives her more profits. In addition she takes care of pigs and sheep she owns, which she raises and feeds to fatten and sell at a higher price. According to her, in times of economic scarcity, the sale of her animals helps her cover the family expenses. Now, her primary objective is to improve the infrastructure of her house. She belongs to the communal bank "Aymara" annd this is her first loan with MFP with which she feels she has moved forwards as she will receive the financial help she needs to meet her objectives. She therefore promises to be prompt with her repayments. She welcomes your support and will invest in the purchase of fertilizers to improve her crops.

loans.use: to buy sacks of fertilizers.

loans.name: Delphine

texts.en: Delphine is 22 years old. She is married, with 4 children. She sells different items in her store for which she has been running for the period of 3 years. All profits go to schooling her children. She wants the loan to add more merchandise like rice, sugar and cooking oil. She expects to use the profits from this business to set up a wholesale shop to supply the small business people. In the future, she expects to be the major supplier.

loans.use: to buy some items for her shop

loans.name: Felix

texts.es:
Félix de 43 años, convive con Carmen con quien tiene a sus 6 hijos cuyas edades oscilan entre 20 y 3 años. Esta numerosa familia vive en una casa propia en la comunidad nativa de Pachacutec en la provincia Chanchamayo.  Félix es un hombre que trabaja sin descanso, es que no tiene alternativa. Su anhelo de superación por el bienestar de su familia es su motor principal. 
Es así que, en su parcela y media de terrenos de cultivo siembra café y achiote. Una vez cosechado traslada sus productos hacia la ciudad de Pichanaki, ahí vende los frutos al menudeo en un puesto de venta que instala en el mercado. “Cuando hay suerte los compradores vienen hacia Pachacutec y se llevan la mercadería”, menciona Félix, señalando como uno de sus inconvenientes lo tedioso que es movilizar su producción hacia la ciudad.
En el trabajo recibe la ayuda de su esposa quien además de cuidar su hogar, destina parte de su tiempo a las labores del campo. Sus hijos también aportan sus energías para agilizar el trabajo. Muchas veces se ahorró el dinero del pago a operarios por trabajar con ellos.
Félix anhela comprarse más terrenos para aumentar su producción. Sería la primera vez que él recibiría un crédito de MFP, por eso se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas. “Los Claveles de Pachacutec” es el nombre de su banco comunal, menciona que será constante y participativo en las actividades del grupo.
Félix está orgulloso de no usar abonos de ninguna clase. Por eso el dinero que obtenga lo destinará en el pago de personal para la limpieza de sus tierras, además iniciará otra siembra de café comprando plantitas.
texts.en:
Félix, 43, lives with Carmen; they have six children whose ages range between 20 and 3 years.  This large family lives in their own house located in the indigenous community of Pachacutec in Chanchamayo Province.  Félix is a man who works tirelessly; he has no alternative.  His desire to get ahead for his family’s wellbeing is his main motivating factor.

Thus he grows coffee and achiote on his one and a half parcels of farmland.  Once harvested, he transports his products to the city of Pichanaki where he sells the fruit at retail in a stand he sets up in the market.  “When there is luck, buyers come to Pachacutec and take the merchandise,” Félix mentions, pointing out as one of his inconveniences how tedious it is to have to transport his products to the city.

His wife helps him with his work in addition to caring for the home; she dedicates some of her time to work in the field.  His children also contribute their energy to make the work easier; many times the money that would have gone to pay laborers was saved thanks to being able to work with them.

Félix hopes to buy more land to increase production.  This would be the first time he gets an MFP loan and he commits to be punctual with his installment payments.  “Los Claveles de Pachacutec” (Pachacutec Carnations) is the name of his communal bank.  He mentions that he will be constant and participative in the group activities.

Félix is proud that he uses no manure of any kind.  Because of that, the money he gets will be used to pay labor costs for staff to clear his fields.  In addition, he will buy seedlings to start a new plantation.

loans.use: to buy coffee plants and to hire day laborers.

loans.name: Sharifa

texts.en:
Sharifa is a 31-year-old married lady. Her husband works in the military, and Sharifa has a small grocery store in an outside room of her home. She has been running the store for the last five years, and during these five years she has been able to expand the store’s space and add more variety to the products she sells.
Now Sharifa has applied for a loan to purchase more products and move to a new location separate from her home.

loans.use: to purchase more products and move to a new location.

loans.name: Purity

texts.en:
Purity, 25, is a business lady from Kwacha section in Kabompo district, North Western Province, Zambia. She is married with no children. She is asking for a Kiva loan to buy a stove for her restaurant. 

Purity said that she was operating a restaurant with the challenge of not having some equipment, such as a proper stove.

“I have some challenges in doing my business because I do not have equipments like the stove because the one I have is small,” Purity said.

She said that she got motivated through a friend who told her about Rent to Own. 

“When I get a big stove, I think it will be quicker even when preparing food I will be doing it on time,” Purity said. 

Purity mentioned that she is living in a small community and that it is not well developed. She has been thinking about growing her business over the past year, but up until now has not been able to secure a new stove.

“With the things that I have as at now, I can at least make about ZMW 300 per day but I think when I get an equipment, I will be getting more than that because I will be preparing more food than what I can mange now,” Purity said.

It is for this reason Purity is appealing to the Kiva lenders to help her with the loan so that she can buy a stove as soon as possible.

loans.use: To buy a new stove for her restaurant business.

loans.name: Kpang Manga-Nyong Gumah Group

texts.en:
Rafiatu belongs to a group of women who have been in the business of processing shea nuts into shea butter for the past five years. She is a 38-year-old active working woman in her community. Her group belongs to a mother group called Kpan Manga Women's Association. In this group picture, Rafiatu is the second person from the right as you face the group picture.

Rafiatu is married with five children and lives in Nyong-Gumah, a village in the northern part of Ghana. For lack of adequate funds, Rafiatu's solidarity group's prospects of increasing production and later running a supermarket for the shea butter were bleak. The dream has now been rekindled by the introduction of the Kiva programme. Rafiatu is requesting a loan of 1,250 cedis to help her solidarity group fulfill their dream by buying and storing 45 bags of shea nuts for year-round processing. She will then be able to make more profit, repay her loan, and also help feed her family.

loans.use: to buy 45 bags of shea nuts for shea butter extraction

loans.name: Alodo Alome Group

texts.fr: Le groupe ALODO ALOME est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. Rosaline, la représentante du groupe (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 40 ans est mariée à un certain Jean. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Rosaline vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les différentes charges de ménage sont supportées par Rosaline et son mari. Rosaline n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Depuis dix ans, Rosaline vend des bassines dans sa région. Parallèlement à son activité, Rosaline vend aussi de la bouillie de maïs accompagnée de sucres, ce qui lui permet de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Rosaline s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité, Rosaline  sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe ALODO ALOME un cinquième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter des bassines, du maïs et du sucre.

loans.name: Ibtisam's Group

texts.en:
Ibtisam is a member of this group from Iraq. Ibtisam is 55 years old widow  . After her husband death she started her sewing business with an old sewing machine to depend on herself.
She is requesting this (Qard Hassan ) loan that Izdiharona provide for divorced and widow women to buy new sewing machine  and air-cooler  to help her increase her income.
She aims to open big place for her business and create jobs for other women.
The story of Ibtisam and her business is just one of the many examples of Izdiharona for economic development clients .
They preferred to blur their face to cultural reason.

loans.use: A portion of Ibtisam's Group $ 3,000 loan is to buy new sewing machine and air-cooler.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Rosario works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fattening pigs and farming rice businesses. Rosario is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional stocks of groceries to sell to customers.

Rosario has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Valentin

texts.en: Valentin D. is 34 years old. He is married and has one kid. He is in apiarian business for 7 years. Valentin has 50 hives on two different bee yards near the city. He is a specialist not only in honey producing but also is well known as one of the best bee breeder in the region. Valentin D. needs this $ 1200 loan to buy five more bee hives.

loans.use: To buy five more bee hives

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Lucy would like to expand her business by buying a variety of automobile spare parts (especially for Toyota)

loans.name: Thuy

texts.en: Mr Hai is 25 and his wife is 22 years old. They have one child who suffers cardiac disease. They don’t have any land and also don’t have a hut. They have to stay at a rented house. His wife can’t do anything to find money because she has to take care of her daughter who just had an operation for cardiac disease. They had to pay a lot of money for her operation. Mr Hai repairs electronics and sells records at the rented house. This work has increased their income to about $1/person/month. Average income is low at $ 8/person/month. Now, he wants to borrow a loan of $75 again.

loans.use: sells records

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
Nancy D., a member of the Villa Adela Association, is a mother of 3 school-age children. She joined Pro Mujer approximately 1 ½ years ago and worked, from 5 years ago, as a beautician at businesses dedicated to that field.

Three months ago, she changed her line of work and now sells electrical appliances that she brings from the city of Oruro, a business that seems to be more lucrative than what she was doing before.

Nancy now needs to pull together enough capital so that she can take an empty store in her house and convert it to a shop for the sale of electrical appliances, etc., but that will only be possible when she pulls together around $2,000. In the meantime, her goal is to travel to the Oruro to be able to take advantage of the prices before the holidays at the end of the year.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

Nancy D., pertenece a la Asociación Villa Adela, es madre de 3 hijos en edad escolar. Ingresa a Pro Mujer hace aproximadamente 1 año y medio y trabaja hace 5 años como consultora de belleza en empresas dedicadas a este rubro.

Hace 3 meses cambia de rubro y se dedica a la comercialización de electrodomésticos que trae de la ciudad de Oruro, negocio que al parecer le trae más réditos que su anterior actividad.

Actualmente Nancy precisa reunir capital, puesto que ella tiene una tienda vacía en su domicilio, que quiere convertir en un centro de venta de electrodomésticos y varios, pero esto solo será posible cuando ella reúna aproximadamente 2 mil dólares. Mientras tanto su objetivo son los viajes a la ciudad de Oruro para poder aprovechar los precios antes de las fiestas de fin de año.

loans.use: Nancy needs to pull together enough capital so that she can take an empty store in her house and convert it to a shop for the sale of electrical appliances, etc.

loans.name: Betty

texts.es:
Betty C. Mamani is the mother of three children, the youngest of which is only 2 months old. She works in the sale of electronic domestic products in the Eloy Salmón area of the city of La Paz. She has been doing this job for 14 years, starting with just a few products such transistor radios, batteries and small products like that. She buys her products from vendors at the Uyustus fair in order to resell them and make money for herself. Saturation of the market in her area of these products does not allow her to make the kind of sales she desires, so she also works as a wash woman on days when sales are low. For this reason, she is asking for money in order to supply her stall with greater quality and a better variety of products to offer to all of the numerous consumers.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Pendleton, Kiva Volunteer.

Betty C. Mamani, es madre de tres hijos, el menor apenas tiene 2 meses de nacido, se dedica a la venta de electrodomésticos en la zona Eloy Salmón de la ciudad de La Paz. Ya lleva 14 años en esta actividad, comenzando con muy poco, apenas unas pequeñas radios de transistores, baterías y algunos productos pequeños. Ella compra sus productos de mayoristas ubicados en la feria Uyustus, para luego revenderlos y generar sus propios recursos. La saturación en la oferta de estos productos en esa zona, no permite que Betty logre la venta deseada, por lo que se ve obligada a trabajar de lavandera, aquellos días de venta baja. Por tal motivo, precisa de capital para poder surtir más su puesto y tener mayor cantidad y variedad de productos que ofrecer al numeroso público que se da cita a comprar en esa zona.

loans.use: To supply her stall with greater quality and a better variety of products

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is the hardworking mother of three who never had the opportunity to learn how to read or write. She believes that many of the obstacles she encountered in life were caused by illiteracy, and is determined that her children will not suffer the same fate. Esther is looking for ways to pay her children's school fees, and believes she can do that by selling vegetables and other food items to the people of her village. She has come to us for a loan to buy the items she will later sell, and plans to use this new source of income to pay for her children's education.

loans.use: To buy carrots, green beans, plantain, cocoyams

loans.name: Asnia

texts.id:
Asnia lives together with her mother, Fatima in Bali. Her husband and her children live in Java. She has food kiosk business in Bali. Besides selling rice dishes, she also provides drinks such as juice drinks and coffee, fried banana, spring roll, crackers and bread. Once every 2 days, she goes to Badung market to buy the materials, but sometimes she gets the suppliers to deliver the materials to her kiosk. She earns daily profit of Rp 15,000 (about $1.6). She uses the profit for the business continuation and also for her children's education (Rp 200,000 - about $21 per month). She lives with her mother who sells second-hand goods with earning of Rp 25,000 (about $2.6) per day. She shares the living and rent expenses with her mother.

Translated from Indonesian by Kustini Lim, Kiva volunteer.

Asnia bersama ibunya - Fatima - tinggal di bali. Sementara suami dan anak – anaknya tinggal di Jawa. Usaha yang ia tekuni semenjak tinggal di Bali adalah Usaha Warung Makanan. Selain menjual nasi ia juga menyediakan, antara lain : minuman berupa juice dan kopi, pisang goreng, lumpia krupuk dan roti. Setiap dua hari sekali ia pergi ke Pasar Badung untuk membeli barang dagangannya, tapi kadang ada juga suplier yang langsung membawakan barang ke warung tempat ia berjualan. Per hari ia mendapatkan keuntungan Rp 15.000,00. Dari keuntungan yang diperoleh, selain untuk modal usaha dia juga kirim ke Jawa untuk pendidikan anak – anaknya Rp 200.000,00/bulan. Dia tinggal bersama Ibunya yang berjualan barang bekas dengan penghasilan Rp 25.000,00 per harinya. Biaya hidup dan biaya kontrak dia tanggung bersama ibunya.

loans.use: To add more capital

loans.name: Fanta

texts.en: Fanta is married with one child.  She is 28 years old and sells palm oil in the village.  She used to sell 3 gallons each day, but with her previous loans her business increased to 15 gallons.  She is requesting for a loan to expand and diversify her business.

loans.use: She would like to add additional items to her stock to diversify and create new business.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma, 28 years old, is married and lives together with her husband. Fatuma has been selling clothes since 1996. Everyday, she works from 10am to 6pm at her business.

In the past, Fatuma has taken out loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Epifania's Group

texts.es:
Rosa, Julia, and Victoria have belonged to the Agua Viva communal bank for 13, 9, and 13 years, respectively.

Rosa is separated, is 29-years-old, and has one son, who is 12-years-old. Rosa makes homemaD. Ayacuchan chocolates in her home. She purchases the inputs from the Ayacuchana jungle at wholesale prices.

On the other hand, Teofila is married, is 52-years-old, and has 8 children, 4 of whom live with her. Teofila rents land with plants which she later harvests. Teofila also grows vegetables.

Epifania is married, is 50-years-old, and has 4 children. She sells food at the entrance of a medical clinic.

Rosa, Julia, and Victoria need loans of 600 soles, 1000 soles, and 600 soles, money which will be invested in the purchase of sugar, insecticides, chicken, lettuce, potatoes, and the payment of laborers.

The dreams of Rosa, Julia, and Victoria are to make chocolates in larger quantities, to sell products in the wholesale foods market in the city of Ayacucho, and to see their children finish their studies and be better than they are.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Rosa, Julia y Victoria pertenecen al Banco Comunal Agua Viva hace 13, 9, 13 años respectivamente.

Rosa es separada, tiene 29 años y 1 hijo D. 12 años, Rosa elabora chocolates ayacuchanos D. manera artesanal en su casa, Rosa compra los insumos D. la selva ayacuchana al por mayor.

Por otro lado Teofila es casada, tiene 52 años y 8 hijos D. los cuales 4 viven con ella, Teofila alquila terrenos con tunales D. terceros y luego lo cosecha. Además Teofila se dedica a la agricultura D. verduras.

Mientras que Epifania es casada, tiene 50 años y 4 hijos, Epifania venD. comida en la puerta D. una posta medica.

Rosa, Julia y Victoria necesitan préstamos D. 600 soles, 1000 soles, 600 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra D. azúcar, insecticidas, pollo, lechuga, papa y para el pago D. los peones.

Los sueños D. Rosa, Julia y Victoria son elaborar en mayor cantidad sus chocolates, vender sus productos en el mercado D. abastos D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho, que sus hijos terminen D. estudiar y sean mejores que ellas.

loans.use: Rosa, Julia, and Victoria need loans of 600 soles, 1000 soles, and 600 soles, money which will be invested in the purchase of sugar, insecticides, chicken, lettuce, potatoes, and to pay laborers.

loans.name: Darine

texts.en: Darine is a 49 years old woman with 5 children. She works and lives in Aley. Darine is a products agent and this is the fifth time she has applied for a loan at Al Majmoua. She wants to buy new merchandise to sustain and develop her business.

loans.use: to buy new merchandise

loans.name: Tania Benturina

texts.es:
Tania is 39 years old, married but separated from her husband and has 2 daughters, 12 and 8 years old. Both study at primary level. Tania takes care of her daughters´expenses with help from her parents, who live with them.

She has a technical diploma in management. For 10 years she has worked as a cashier at the San Francisco de Asis school from 7:30 am to 5:30 pm. She is requesting a loan which will used to build a closet and paint a room in her home, an improvement she would like to make as she currently does not have a safe place to store her belongings and the walls have not had any maintenance for several years. At this time she has more emotional stability in her life and thinks about improving her standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Tania de 39 años de edad, es casada pero está separada de su esposo, tiene 2 hijas de 12 y 8 años , ambas estudian la primaria, ella asume los gastos de sus hijas con el apoyo de sus padres, habita en casa de ellos.

Tiene un diploma de técnico en dirección de la economía; tiene 10 años de laborar como cajera en el Colegio San Francisco de Asis en horario de 7:30 a.m. a 5:30 pm, está solicitando su crédito, el que utilizará para la construccion de un closet y pintura en su dormitorio, esta mejora la realizará debido a que no tiene un lugar seguro para guardar sus pertenencias y las paredes ya tiene varios años sin mantenimiento. En este momento se encuentra con mas estabilidad emocional y está pensando en mejorar sus condiciones de vida.

loans.use: Build a closet and paint a room in her home.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
DON MANUEL, being a farmer, goes out in the mornings to treat and fumigate his fields so that he can combat the diverse diseases that may harm his crops. And this is how we find him, on his way to his fields with all the necessary tools for his work and he tells us that due to the high prices of fertilizers and treatments, his living has been affected and above all his products. Faced with this situation Don Manual is asking for a loan with the goal to improve the care of his crops and continue his work.

Translated from Spanish by Diane Lister, Kiva Volunteer.

DON MANUEL, por su actividad agrícola sale por las mañanas a curar y fumigar sus terrenos de cultivo para que pueda así combatir las diversas plagas o enfermedades que puedan perjudicar sus productos agrícolas. Y así lo encontramos rumbo a su chacra con todas sus herramientas necesarias para su trabajo y nos comentó que debido a los costos altos de los abonos y medicinas ha perjudicado su economía y sobre todo sus productos.Frente a esta situación Don Manuel solicita un préstamo a fin de mejorar el cuidado sus cultivos y continuar con su labor.

loans.use: Purchase of manure and natural fertilizers

loans.name: Good Luck Group

texts.en:
Yeabu Z. K. is the group leader. She owns a stall of general merchandise in the market of Magburaka in Sierra Leone. Yeabu is 50 years old and married with three children; she has been running her business for the last ten years on a very small scale. She would like to expand the business for one of her children to take over in the future, and also to increase her income to meet her children's school requirements.

Aminata S., Adama K. and Yeabu G. all sell various food items at the same market in Magburaka. Together, the four are requesting a group loan to expand their individual businesses.

loans.use: Purchase more rice, palm oil, onions, and sugar.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth T. is a fishmonger who buys fresh fish and then processes them for sale. She is married, but her husband's income is not sufficient for Elizabeth and her 2 children. Demand for her fish is high, and she is looking to expand her business to increase her profits.

She is asking for additional capital to expand her business.

loans.use: Additional capital to expand her business

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en: Fatima is 44 years old, married, and has 4 children. Fatima lives in Beirut with her family and somehow finds the time to run a small grocery shop in her neighborhood. Fatima has requested a loan of $700 for the maintenance of her store. This will be Fatima's second loan with Al Majmoua.

loans.use: To fund necessary repairs at Fatima's grocery store

loans.name: Mekheddin

texts.en:
Mekheddin B. is a 64 year old man who sells cigarettes, sunflowers and nuts in the central street of the small village of Imishli city. This business is the main financial income for his family since a very small pension forced Mekheddin to go out to sell products on the street.

He has six children and they try to help their father financially but Mekheddin never accepts financial support from them. He believes that while he is healthy and can make money himself, he will never ask for someone's help. He just needs more funds to expand his business and start selling beverages and cookies. For this purpose he has applied for a loan of US$1200. He appreciates your help very much. Let's do our best to help this old but very proud man!

loans.use: to buy beverages and cookies for resale

loans.name: Birane

texts.fr: Birane n' est pas marié il est agé de 26 ans . Il s' exerce le metier de tailleur  depuis plus de cinq ans Il y tire l' essentiel de ses revenus.son adhesion à la caisse remonte à 8 mois. Avec l approche de la fete de la tabasky,il fait face à une forte sillicitation  de la part de clients .le nombre de machines dont il dispose ne plus permet pas de repondre à cette demande ainsi il sollicite un pret pour acquerir une nouvelle machine à coudre.
texts.en:
Birane is unmarried and 26 years old. He's been a tailor for more than five years, a job that constitutes his main revenue. He joined UIMCEC eight months ago. With the Tabasky Feast (Eid al-Kabi) approaching, he experiences high customer demand, which he cannot meet due to an insufficient number of sewing machines. He's therefore seeking a loan to buy a new sewing machine.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es: Victoria tiene 48 años, vive con sus 2 hijos. Se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales desde hace más de 30 años, periódicamente vende en las  ferias ganaderas, generalmente después de 6 meses de crianza y alimentación balanceada que ella misma prepara, sus animales están en peso para ser comercializados. También separa algunos para su consumo propio. En sus tierras siembra todo tipo de tubérculos y granos y desde hace varios meses ella viaja a otra ciudad para vender en pocas cantidades parte de su cosecha. Victoria realiza este esfuerzo porque es el único sostén de sus hijos. Es la primera vez que Victoria solicita un préstamo en MFP, fue recomendada por su banco comunal porque saben que es responsable en sus pagos de devolución. El dinero será invertido en la compra de más animales, como un torete para poder venderlo después.
texts.en:
Victoria is 48 years old and she lives with her 2 children. She has been raising and selling livestock for more than 30 years, periodically selling at the fairs. Generally after 6 months of care and a well-balanced diet that she prepares herself, her livestock attain the weight ideal for sale. She sets some of them for their own consumption. On her lands she harvests root vegetables and grains and for the past many months she has travelling to another city to sell her harvest in small batches. This is the first time Victoria has requested a loan from MFP (Kiva Field Partner). She was recommended by her Community Bank, known to them as being resonsible with her payments. The funds will be invested in the purchase of more livestock, such as a calf to later sell.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase livestock to raise and sell.

loans.name: Maria Ramona

texts.es:
La Señora Maria Ramona Ramírez tiene la edad de 57 años, su estado civil es casada, Doña Maria tiene 5 hijos de los cuales todos trabaja por cuenta propia y ninguno de sus hijos depende de ella, su esposo no labora, sus propósitos son engrandecer su negocio para que su venta prospere sus deseos son salir sacar adelante a su familia y poder cancelar los compromisos contraídos con la institución y en sus sueños esta proporcionarle mejoras a su vivienda por lo que no ha podido realizarle los cambios deseados por la difícil situación.


La actividad económica a la que se dedica es una pulpería y una venta de comida, la ubicación de su negocio es su casa de habitación en telica de la alcaldía ½ cuadra al norte, el tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio es de 20 años, Doña Maria inicia su negocio por cuenta propia por lo que necesita proporcionar ingresos para su familia en sus casa de habitación decide establecer un negocio de de verduras por lo que con este negocio no logro progresar mucho y decide quitar el negocio de verduras para instalar una venta de granos básicos como lo es arroz, frijoles y aceite y es así como obtiene la afluencia de sus clientes, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo ya que tiene que realizar la compra de los productos para la elaboración de sus comidas para ofertarlos a sus clientes ya que es visitado 3 veces a la semana.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Ramona Ramírez is 57 years old and married. She has five children who all work, and none of them depend on her economically. Maria's husband doesn't work, and she'd like to enlarge her business to improve her sales. She'd like to help her family get ahead and be able to pay back her loans. She dreams of renovating her home, but hasn't been able to make the changes she'd like because of the difficult situation. Maria runs a local store and sells meals. Her store is located in her home, in the town of telica half a block north of the mayor's office. She's had this business for 20 years. Maria started the business on her own because she needed to earn income for her family. She decided to establish a vegetables business in her house, but it didn't do well and she decided to quit the vegetable business in favor of selling grains such as rice, beans, and cooking oil. With this new business Maria earned the patronage of her clients. She'd like a loan to use as working capital, as she now has clients who come three times a week and she needs to purchase materials to make her foods so that she can offer them to her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Hosamoh

texts.ru: Рахмонова Хосамох проживает в городе Яван. Замужем и имеет пятерых детей. нигде не работает , но дома имеет небольшое хозяйство , где имеет несколько голов крупно и мелкорогатого скота. Для того, чтобы увеличить поголовье животных хочет получить кредит и купить одного породистго бычка. Это сможет дать ей возможность получать породистое потомство. погасить кредит планирует в течение 12 есяцев.
texts.en:
Hosamoh R. lives in the town of Yavan. She is married and has five children. She does not work outside the home, but has a small farm where she has several head of large and small-horned cattle. To increase the size of the herd, she would like to take out a loan to purchase a purebred bull. This would enable her to acquire purebred offspring. She will repay the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a bull

loans.name: Abbasali

texts.en: Abbasali Z. is a 25-year-old, single man. Abbasali has a food store where he sells different kind of goods such as candies, cookies, tea, macaronis, washing powder, matches and other goods. He proudly states that he has been in this line of business for two years. The income he is able to generate from his business allows him to support his family (he is the sole breadwinner for his parents). Abbasali purchases his goods from a neighboring city. He is requesting a loan in the amount of $1200 USD over a 15-month term, the proceeds of which will be used to expand his inventory of goods (i.e., he plans to purchase additional confectionaries). Abbasali thanks everyone for their support, and he promises to repay his loan on time.

loans.use: To purchase food products

loans.name: Roida

texts.en:
Roida has been selling food in the Nzovwe neighborhood of Mbeya for three years. She is a member of the Amani loan group (group code 2005).  She currently earns an average monthly profit of $185.  Everyday she works at her business for twelve hours. 

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more food items (rice, beans, onion, carrots and milk) for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profits will increase and she will be able to expand her business.  

Roida is married and has five children ages 32, 30, 28 and 26.

loans.use: To buy more food items (rice, beans,onion, carrots and milk) for the expansion of her business.

loans.name: Bashiran Rana Khalid Group

texts.en:
Bashiran baji is the wife of R. K. and they have lived in a mid-size city named Vehari, Pakistan for the past 15 years. She is the mother of four kids: two sons and two daughters. Her sons are enrolled in a school, getting an education. Her daughters don't study and help her in her decorative embroidery business. Her husband operates a clothes-selling business. He has been in this profession for the past 10 years. He buys clothes from a famous city (Multan) and sells them in his native city. Sometimes Bashiran baji helps him also by selling his clothes in the community. She is applying for a loan to buy clothes to expand her husband’s clothes-selling business.

Bashiran baji is the group leader for four other women from her locality. Suraiya Naheed baji wants a loan to buy clothes to sell. Another Suraiya baji wants a loan to buy ingredients (lentils, cooking oil and spices) for her food business. Naziran baji wants a loan to buy goats and sheep for her animal-selling business. Zuhra baji wants a loan to repair her auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Gulsunbibi

texts.ru: Гулсунбиби - пожилая женщина 62 лет. Замужем и мать 4-х детей. Её муж занимается перепродажей скота на скотном рынке. Он покупает там дешевле, и через неделю продает, если найдется хороший покупатель, который купит его скот за хорошую цену. Сыновья помогают отцу. Один сын уехал в Россию. Он там работает и высылает деньги родителям. Невестки помогают по хозяйству. У них очень большая и дружная семья. Они очень трудолюбивые и все работают, чтобы улучшить свой семейный бюджет.
texts.en:
Gulsunbibi is an elderly woman who is 62 years old. She is married and the mother of 4 children. Her husband resells livestock at the livestock market. He purchases the livestock at a cheaper price and resells it after a week if he finds a good buyer who will purchase his livestock at a good price. The sons help the father. One son is a migrant worker in Russia. He works there and sends money home to his parents. The daughters-in-law help with housekeeping. They have a very large and happy family. They are industrious and all work in order to improve their family finances.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Trading Livestock

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en:
Antonia is 53 years old and married to an ordinary carpenter. They are blessed with healthy children who are now helping them with their financial needs. Antonia lives with her husband and her children in Barangay Minanga Sur Iguig, Cagayan. She has been in the hog-raising business for the past eight years. In this way, she helps her husband meet the needs of their family. She and her husband also work together to improve their rice farming, which adds to their income.

Antonia works hard in order to make her hog-raising business more productive. She is a very responsible wife and mother to her children. Aside from that, she is also a good neighbor and friend to everyone. She always wants to have a better living and to earn more profit. Therefore, she wants a loan of PHP11,000 for the maintenance of her hog- raising business. She wishes to add capital to buy more sacks of hog grower and feed for her pigs to become healthy. She also wants more piglets to raise in order to expand her business in the village. She believes that the loan will be of great help in developing a good standard of living.

loans.use: Buy more sacks of hog grower and feed

loans.name: Alice's Group

texts.en:
Alice N. is the leader of the Twezimbe group in Lugazi. She is a hard working lady. She has been farming and selling agricultural products since she was married in 1963,. She grows food for her customers and for home consumption and she is able to make a profit of 50,000 per week. Her dream is to expand her farming practices. With her share of this loan, she is going to grow and sell tomatoes and she hopes to make something big out of it.

Alice is a widow with six children. She also cares for eleven dependents, including her step children who have no mothers.

loans.use: To buy supplies to grow tomatoes for sale.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es: Teresa tiene 59 años, es madre soltera, vive junto a sus 2 hijos que son solteros y trabajan. Su actividad es la venta D. ropa D. segundo uso en los caseríos que quedan a 5 días D. viaje en lancha por el río Ucayali. Su metodología para vender es al contado o los cambia por algún otro producto como plátanos, yucas, maíz, entre otros. Este trabajo lo viene realizando desD. hace 2 años y lo que le gusta es el viaje por el río, porque la relaja y va conociendo otros caseríos donD. pueD. vender posteriormente, además que trabajar la hace sentirse útil. Teresa considera que su negocio le es rentable porque sus prendas se venden todas, debido a que estas personas no tienen mucho acceso a los mercados o tiendas D. la ciudad. Posteriormente quiere llegar a tener una tienda D. ropa y estabilizar su negocio, porque viajar constantemente y rutas tan largas, son muy riesgosas debido a los asaltos. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, y lo que le gusta D. su banco comunal es que ha notado que todos sus compañeros son unidos y responsables. Con el dinero que solicita comprará más ropa D. variedad D. modelos y tamaños.
texts.en:
Teresa is a 59 year old single mother who lives together with her 2 unmarried, working children. She sells second-hand clothes in the small villages that are up to 5 days away by boat through the Ucayali river. Her business is to sell the items for cash or exchange them for other product like bananas, yuccas, and corn, among others. For 2 years she has been working and making the trip through the river. She likes the trip because it relaxes her and she is beginning to know other small villages where she can later sell her goods. Also, the work makes her feel useful. Teresa considers her business profitable because all her articles are sold as people do not have access to the markets or stores in the city. Subsequently, she wants to have a clothing store to stabilize her business because the constant travel and the long routes are very risky due to assaults. This it is her first loan with MFP, and what she likes about her communal bank is that she has noticed how all colleagues are united and responsible. With the money that she is asking for she will buy more variety of clothes in different styles and sizes.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Reynolds, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase merchandise

loans.name: Gloria Maria

texts.es: Doña Gloria Maria Gutiérrez, reside en el barrio Hialeah en la capital de Managua, tiene 47 años de edad, con un hijo mayor de edad, es viuda. Su negocio es un cafetín que desde hace seis años administra, el cual inicio con apoyo de su esposo sus planes es poder ofertar en mayores cantidad de productos y variedades  a sus clientes. Con este crédito es su cuarto ciclo el cual va invertir en la compra de materiales para construir pantry y remodelar la cocina. Da las gracias a la institución por los beneficios de crecer en el negocio como en las mejoras logradas hasta ahora.
texts.en:
Ms. Gloria Maria Gutiérrez lives in the Hialeah neighborhood of the capital city of Managua. She is a 47-year-old widow with a grown-up son. She has owned a snack bar for 6 years, setting it up with the support of her husband. She plans to be able to offer a greater amount and variety of products to her patrons. She is in her fourth loan cycle, and she will invest the loan in purchasing construction materials to build a pantry and remodel the kitchen. She gives thanks to the institute for helping her business grow.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to build a pantry and remodel the kitchen

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is an 18-year-old man who lives in Tyre, Southern Lebanon. Hassan has owned a coffee shop for a year. He also serves narguileh (also known as shisha in Egypt). Narguileh is an ancient tradition enjoyed by the people of the Middle East. A tall (or short) water pipe is used to smoke fruit-flavored tobacco. Narguileh is enjoyed in cafes across the Middle East and is beginning to gain popularity in the US, Europe and other countries. Hassan also has a billiard table for those who want to play.

Hassan requested a loan of $700 US from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his shop. This is the first time that Hassan has requested a loan. Hassan is special in his work because he knows how to treat his clients and clients feel comfortable going to his coffee shop. His clients are his friend, neighbors and others. When he first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties. Hassan decided on this business because he wanted to work independently and he has always wanted to have a coffee shop. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for a coffee shop

loans.name: Shavkatjon

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 

Гаффоров Шавкатжон-мужчина ,28 лет – женат имеет одного ребёнка, его жена  Махмудова Мукаддас воспитывает своего ребенка на дому присматривает за хозяйством. Шавкатчон занимается торговлей более 12 лет. Его хлеб за этот счет . Он продаёт овощи и фрукты по сезону и заказывает товар поставщикам. Он узнал о кредитовании по наслышке и решил  попробовать. Сперва у него был маленький ассортимент и после первой выдачи его дела резко пошли на улучшение,так как Шавкатчон уже стал закупать большую партию товара. Теперь он благодарен нашей организации за предоставленную поддержку.
texts.en:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Shavkatjon G. is 28 years old, married and has one child. His wife Mukaddas Mahmudova raises their child at home and takes care of the household. Shavkatjon has been doing retail for more than twelve years. He earns the daily bread. He sells fruits and vegetables which are in season and orders the produce from suppliers. He found out about the loan program by a word of mouth and decided to try it. At first he had a small assortment and after the first loan his business has drastically improved because Shavkatjon has began to buy in large quantities. Now he is grateful to our organization for the support it provided.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Nasiba

texts.ru: Насиба Акобирова проживает в районе Руми. Возраст 22 года. Насиба свободна, детей не имеет, живет вместе с родителями. По специальности Насиба "швея". Она более 3 лет занимается пашивом одежды у себя на дому. Она также берет учеников и обучает их (платно). Кредит просит для покупки новой швейной машинки.
texts.en:
Nasiba A. lives in the Rumy region. She is 22 years old. Nasiba is free and does not have children, she lives with her parents. Nasiba is a seamstress by profession. She has been sewing clothing at home for more than three years. She also accepts students and teaches for a fee. She is asking for a loan to buy a new sewing machine.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice C. sells fruits such as bananas, apples, grapes and so on at Bosodwina near Shama Junction. She has been in business since 2005. Alice is married and has two children. Her husband is a surveyor. She has senior high school education. Alice uses her income to help with the payment of bills and school fees. Alice will use this loan to purchase more fruits to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Alice plans to improve her plantation farm.

loans.use: To purchase more fruits

loans.name: Mrs. Pol Bun Village Bank Loan Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan is made up of 13 people living in the village of Tboung Damrei in the province of Takeo. Each member will use their loan for a different purpose. Mrs. Pol B. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. She is a food seller. Her husband, Mr. P. Prunh, is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivates rice. He is currently encountering a problem because his field has infertile soil. For this reason, Mrs. Pol B. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer with which to support the field in order to make crop more productive. She is 61 years old and the mother of a grown child who is a construction worker.

Six members in this group loans have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Tebug

texts.en:
