V. is a widow and she is having five children with three of them below the age of fifteen years. She lives in Acha-tudit in Cameroon. V. and her entire family lives in a house with three rooms. This is V.’s fourth year as a GHAPE member; she has been in GHAPE since the year 2005. With the loan given to her, she plans to buy cocoyams, palm oil, ground nuts, and Koki beans for retailing. She is convinced the business will succeed because of the good business site she is having, she is also having a ready market for her goods to be sold. V. has encountered some major challenges in life shush as the death of her husband, ill health and un adequate funds to pay for her children school fees. Because of all these, V. saw GHAPE as a source of relief in the year 2005 and became a member. With the profit from her loan, she plans to pay her children school fees, Cloth them, give good feeding to her family and sound medication when ever they are sick. This her project will help the community to supply them with food stuff, provide them with late night services for those who wants to buy some food items in the night. V. prefer to receive loan from GHAPE because the method of repayment is comfortable and convenient, GHAPE is trust worthy and reliable and loans are given without any collateral security. 
The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: Buying and Selling of Cocoyams, Groundniuts, Palm oil and Koki Beans

loans.name: Bilma

texts.es:
Bilma es una mujer de 42 años, está casada con Miguel; su pareja de toda la vida, quien tiene 60 año; y con él tiene un hijo (Jesús), de 14 años, que es el orgullo de ambos.
Ella anhela reaperturar su tienda de comestibles, que en otrora tenía en su casa,  ya que hace 3 años tuvo que cerrarla por motivos personales. Bilma recuerda cuando tenía su tienda y atendía amablemente a sus vecinos y le era muy rentable, ahora piensa volver a su negocio y hacerlo mejor que antes, con mayor cantidad de productos y con instalaciones más amplias. Con este negocio en su casa podrá obtener mejores ganancias económicas y no descuidaría a su familia, que es su mayor preocupación.

Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP y desde ya planea cancelar todas sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que tiene grandes sueños por cumplir y solo serán realidad si ella es responsable. Para concretar sus sueños está solicitando este crédito, y con él implementará su tienda para lograr de nuevo atender a sus clientes y ganar dinero para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Bilma is 42 years old and married to Miguel, her partner in life who is 60 years old. They have a 14 year old son Jesús, who is their pride and joy.

She longs to reopen the grocery store she managed out of her home. Three years ago, she had to shut it down for personal reasons. When she had her shop, Bilma remembers having to kindly attend to her neighbors and generating decent profits. Looking back, she believes she can do better than before by offering more products and providing better facilities. Since her business is in her home, Bilma believes she can generate better earnings without neglecting her family, which is a major concern of hers.

This is her second loan with MFP. Bilma already plans to make her payments on time because she has big dreams to fulfill and can only do so if she is responsible. To make her dreams reality, she will use the loan she requested to reopen her store and get back to serving customers. She hopes to generate an income so that she can help her husband with the household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Reopen her grocery store

loans.name: Maria Evangelina

texts.es:
El banco comunal Corazón de Jesús está ubicado  en la parroquia el Valle al  suroeste de la ciudad de Cuenca en el sur del país, esta región  es conocida por su mayor  producción de maíz, fréjol, papas, etc., también por los atractivos turísticos como son los sitios arqueológicos de Gullanzhapa y Pedernales, su gente es muy cordial y amable con el turista nacional y extranjero.

La señora  María Evangelina T. es socia del banco comunal Corazón de Jesús, vive en la parroquia el Valle en la comunidad de Poloma; tiene 48 años de edad y está divorciada hace cinco años por problemas en su hogar  y por la falta de  comprensión con su esposo, fruto de su unión conyugal procreó cinco  hijos de 25, 23, 18, 14, 12 años; sus tres primeros hijos ya son casados,  de los cuales la menor vive en su casa y comparten los gastos del hogar,  su penúltimo hijo trabaja en una carpintería y lo poco que gana también aporta para el hogar mientras que su último hijo aún es estudiante de  secundaria, su casa es propia fruto de su esfuerzo y de todos sus hijos.

María trabaja como empleada domestica eventualmente cuando sus vecinas o conocidas le avisan, también se dedica a la crianza de pollos, chanchos, cuyes, pavos y una vaca lechera entregando a sus vecinos de la comunidad la leche obtenida mientras que  sus animales vende en la comunidad o en las ferias.

Este es su segundo ciclo trabajando con  la institución y los créditos obtenidos ha invertido en la compra de sus animales, con el nuevo préstamo que la FUNDACIÓN ESPOIR le entregue  lo va a invertir en la compra mas animalitos como pollos, cuyes,  así como comida y vitaminas para su crianza y, otra parte de dinero recibido va a invertir en su hogar.

Su sueño es de poder construir una casa para sus hijos menores.
texts.en:
The Heart of Jesus Communal Bank is located in El Valle Parrish, which is southwest of the city of Cuenca in southern Ecuador. This region is primarily known for its production of corn, beans, potatoes, and other crops. It also has tourist attractions, such as the archeological sites in Gullanzhapa and Pedernales. The people are very friendly and kind to domestic and foreign tourists.

Sra. María Evangelina T. is a member of the Heart of Jesus Communal Bank. She lives in the community of Poloma in El Valle Parrish. She is 48 years old and divorced from her husband 5 years ago because of domestic and marital problems. She has five children ranging in age from 12 to 25. Her first three children are married, with one of them living at home and contributing toward the household expenses. The fourth child works as a carpenter and also helps around the house. The youngest child is a high school student. María’s home is a by-product of her hard work and that of all of her children.

She works as a housekeeper whenever her neighbors and acquaintances are in need of cleaning services. María also raises chickens, pigs, guinea pigs, and turkeys to sell within the community or at fairs. In addition, she has a dairy cow that produces milk that she sells to neighbors.

This is her second cycle working with the Institution. Her previous loans were used to purchase her animals. With this new loan from Fundación ESPOIR, she will buy more animals such as chickens and guinea pigs, as well as feed and vitamins. Part of the money will be used for some household expenses.

María’s dream is to build a house for her younger children.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase feed, vitamins, and additional animals

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es:
Angélica tiene 46 años, está casada y es madre de 6 hijos.
Desde hace 11 años viene trabajando en su tienda de abarrotes situado en su misma vivienda. Este negocio es muy concurrido, especialmente por sus vecinos, pues está en la parte alta del pueblo. Angélica ama su trabajo; por ello, muy temprano por la mañana alegremente va barriendo y ordenando sus estantes, ya que le gusta que estén limpios y atractivos.
La consigna de doña Angélica es “no cerrar”, de tener que realizar las compras prefiere encargarle a su esposo, mediante  una lista y como él tiene un carro, no gasta en transporte, así evita cerrar su tienda y perder ventas. 

Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por lo que hace el compromiso de pagar en las fechas señaladas todas sus cuotas, asimismo ha juramentado como la presidenta de su banco comunal. El dinero que solicita lo invertirá en el incremento de más productos comestibles para su negocio.
texts.en:
Angélica is 46 years old, married, and the mother of 6 children. For 11 years, she has worked in the grocery store located in her home. Her business is very busy, frequented mostly by neighbors since it is located in the upper part of town. Angélica loves her job, which explains why she can be found in her store early in the morning cheerfully sweeping and organizing shelves. She likes everything to be clean and attractive. The sign in front of her store says “Never Closed”. Therefore, she leaves her husband in charge of securing merchandise by providing him a list of the products she needs. He brings back the supplies in his car in order to save on shipping costs. Doña Angélica never closes her shop to avoid the risk of losing sales.

This is her first loan with MFP. She is committed to making her payments on the established due dates. In addition, Angélica was recently sworn in as president of her Communal Bank. The money she requested will be used to purchase more food products for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase additional inventory for her store

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
El socio FRANCISCO pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN DE CHAPI”. 

El socio tiene 40 años de edad, es soltero y no tiene hijos. El viven en el distrito de Santiago de la provincia del Cusco. El socia es estilista y tiene un salón de belleza “FRANCHESCA COIFIUR” en la calle Rocopata, al costado del mercado de “San Pedro” del Cusco. Ya son varios años que trabaja en el negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo. Nuestro socio es trabajador y emprendedor que quiere hacer crecer su peluquería. El socio requiere el préstamo para invertir en la peluquería comprando más materiales para hacer cortes de cabellos modernos y comprar materiales de maquillaje.
  
El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma
texts.en:
Francisco is a member of the Virgen de Chapi Communal Bank. She is 40, single, and has no children. She lives in the Santiago district in the Cusco province. She is a stylist. She has a beauty shop, Franchesca Coifur, on Rocopata Street on the side of the San Pedro Market in Cusco. She has worked in this business for several years. It has gone very well for her thanks to all of the effort that she puts into her work. She is an enterprising and hard-working member who wants to make her hair salon grow. She needs the loan to buy more materials to do modern haircuts and to buy make up. She is grateful for the opportunity of the loan, and she promises to pay it on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more materials to do modern haircuts and to buy make up

loans.name: Celia

texts.es:
La socia es natural de la ciudad de Urcos de la provincia de Quispicanchis del departamento del Cusco y pertenece al Banco Comunal “Qori Orcco” de la Asociación Arariwa. El nombre del banco es de origen de la lengua Quechua que traducido al español significa “Cerro de Oro”. Cusco antiguamente, fue la capital del Imperio Inca y una de las ciudades más importantes del Virreinato del Perú. Declarada Patrimonio de la Humanidad y capital arqueológica de América. 

Nuestra socia CELIA tiene 32 años, es conviviente y tiene tres hijos: José tiene 9 años y esta cursando el tercer grado de primaria, Katherine tiene 7 años y esta cursando el primero de primaria y Kathy Marilyn tiene 5 años y esta en el jardín. La socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con el negocio de venta de plantas medicinales embolsadas como las hierbas de muña, chancapiedra, hercampuri, pasuchaca, lavanda, malva, valeriana, achiote, ayahuasca, llantén, menta, maca y Yacón. Ya son diez años que tiene el negocio y le ha ido muy bien, gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo. Nuestra socia es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia. La socia requiere el préstamo para comprar más plantas medicinales que son buenas para cerebro, riñones, estomago, etc.       

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.

La ciudad de Urcos se encuentra ubicada a 45 km del Cusco siguiendo la carretera asfaltada a Puno, es un pequeño poblado con una hermosa laguna donde, según la leyenda, Huascar lanzó una enorme cadena de oro para evitar que los españoles se la llevaran.
texts.en:
Vanesa was born in Urcos, province of Quispicanchis, district of Cusco and she’s a member of the Community Bank “Qori Orcco” part of the Arariwa Association. The name of the bank is in the Quechua language and it means “Golden Hills”. Cusco was the capital city of the Inca Empire and one of the most important cities of the Peruvian Viceroyalty. It has been declared Patrimony of Humanity and the Archaeological Capital of the Americas. Celia is 32 years old. She lives with her common-law husband and their three children: José is 9 and he's in 3rd grade. Katherine is 7 and she's in 1st grade and Kathy Marilyn is 5 and attends pre-school. She divides her time between her household activities and her bagged medicinal plants business. She sells herbs such as muna, chancapiedra, hercampuri, pasuchaca, lavander, mauve, valerian, annato, ayahuasca, plantago, mint, maca and yacon. She’s been doing this for ten years with great success thanks to her hard work. She’s a working mother and an entrepreneur supporting her family. She will use this loan to purchase more medicinal plants that are good for the brain, kidneys, stomach, etc. She’s very thankful for this opportunity and she promises to fulfill her payments according to schedule. The city of Urcos is located at 45 km (28 miles) from Cusco, following the asphalted road to Puno. It’s a small town with a beautiful lagoon, where, according to the legend Huascar threw a huge golden chain to prevent the Spanish settlers to take it away.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase medicinal plants that are good for the brain, kidneys, stomach, etc.

loans.name: Suth

texts.en: Suth V., 43, is married and lives with her four children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. V. has a business selling liquor, dried beef and cakes and is able to earn an income of US $7 per day to help cover the family expenses. She has been in this business since 1998. Her husband sells grilled chicken eggs, earning an income of US $5 per day. V. and her husband try to work hard and help each other to ensure a good standard of living for the family. They are also seeking to improve their businesses. As a result, V. is requesting a loan of US $1000 from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner. She wants to use the expected loan to purchase a motorbike to transport her food products for sale. This is her first loan from CREDIT.

loans.use: buy a motorbike

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan has been farming since 1997.  She and her husband have been patiently tilling their rice field to generate an income for the family. They now have four children, the oldest of whom is 13. 

Susan wants increase their earnings by doubling their harvest.  She applied for a loan from CEVI to help her maintain the farm. She is asking for 7,000 Philippine pesos to buy farm supplies like seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: Farm supplies

loans.name: Mary Lucila

texts.es:
La señora Mary es socia del Banco Comunal “San Pedro” desD. hace 2 años, vive en el distrito D. Acora, provincia y departamento D. Puno, tiene 60 años D. edad, es casada y tiene 06 hijos. Ella  estudio primaria completa, se dedica a la compra y venta D. ganado.

Mary nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, pudo incrementar su capital.

Ella solicitará un crédito  D. S/. 3,000.00 nuevos soles con el cual podrá comprar una vaca lechera y un toro.

Su sueño para el futuro es aumentar sus ventas para así vivir mejor.

Lo que mas le gusta D. su Banco Comunal son las reuniones que hay cada mes.
texts.en:
Mary has been a member of the San Pedro comunal bank for the past two years. She lives in the Acora district in the province and department of Puno. She is 60 years old, is married and has six children. She has an elementary school education and buys and sells livestock. Mary tells us that she used the money from her first loan, of 3,000 PEN, which she obtained though “Movimiento Manuela Ramos,” to increase her working capital. She is asking for this loan of 3000 PEN ($1,075) to invest in a dairy cow and a bull. Her hopes for the future are to increase her sales so that she can have a better life. What she likes best about her communal bank are the get together that they have each month.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in a dairy cow and a bull

loans.name: Freddy Raul

texts.es:
En el barrio La Bajera de San Jacinto  Departamento de Bolívar, queda “Vidrios  y Aluminios San Jacinto”, ese es el nombre del negocio de propiedad de Freddy M. R. que tiene 48 años y en que trabaja con su esposa con quien tiene   3 hijos  en edades de  10 y 3 años.
Con ellos llegó a este municipio después de 10 años de estar administrando fincas en el departamento del Magdalena , porque quiso que sus hijos estudiaran pues estando en una finca estaban los colegios bien distantes, así que solo con  sueños un ahorro y decisión firme emprendieron su negocio cuando un vecino del pueblo inspiró y apoyó su deseo ayudándolo con su experiencia y en talleres de Cartagena aprendió a cortar sus primeros vidrios; desde ese momento consiguió un local  para fabricar puertas y ventanas y vender vidrios aluminio y otros accesorios; este negocio lo atiende  él y su esposa y cuando tiene  mucho trabajo busca trabajadores con el fin de responder a la clientela oportunamente. Con este propósito  está solicitando su segundo crédito a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo por valor de $1.500.000, que será utilizado para comprar aluminio, vidrios y accesorios para la elaboración de puertas y ventanas. 
Con su primer crédito fue muy aplicado tanto en su inversión como en su reembolso  por eso logré aumentar sus utilidades  y simultáneamente  mejoró su historial creditito lo cual para el es muy importante como empresario.
Algún día quiere tener su casa propia, invertir también en ganadería, pero sobre todo sacar adelante a sus hijos mediante una buena educación formal.
El desafío más importante está relacionado con su negocio que la época  de ventas bajas debe proveerlas para  prepararse a responder a sus obligaciones y esto lo hace muy bien porque  tiene su negocio controlado.
Su situación mas difícil fue el cambio del la finca a San Jacinto, aun se sorprende de su capacidad de riesgo ante todas las dificultades que se presentaron, pero eso es cosa del pasado y lo importante es el deseo de superación y la gran alegria que constantemente Freddy expresa.
texts.en:
San Jacinto Glass and Aluminum is located in the La Bajera de San Jacinto neighborhood of the Bolivar province. Freddy M. R. is 48 years old and runs the business with the help of his wife, with whom he has 3 children from 3-10 years old. They moved to this city 10 years ago from Magdalena where he managed some farms. He wanted his kids to be able to study and they lived very far from the schools on their farm. He decided to start his business when a neighbor in Cartagena encouraged him to do so after teaching him how to cut glass. He found a storefront to start making doors and windows and selling glass, aluminum and other accesories. He and his wife run the business and he contracts other workers when things get busy in order to serve his clientele. He is seeking his second loan from Mario Santo Domingo Foundation of $800 which he will use to buy aluminum, glass and accesories to make his doors and windows. With his first loan, he was very diligent both in investing his money and in paying it back; he improved his business and his credit history which is very important for him as an entrepreneur. Someday, he would like to have his own home, invest in livestock, but more than anything he'd like his kids to receive a formal education. His biggest challenge is meeting his obligations during periods of low sales but he has learned to manage his business very well and get through those times. His most difficult time was when he changed work from farming to what we does now; he's still surprised at the risk he took, but he considers it part of his past and his dream now is to move forward and his happiness shows that he is doing so.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase aluminum, glass, accesories to make doors and windows

loans.name: Sadio

texts.fr: Madame Sadio S. est une femme d’une quarantaine d’années  qui évolue  dans le secteur du commerce de légumes. Elle pratique cette activité depuis  plus de 5 ans au marche de Bambilor. Elle a choisi cette activité  génératrice  de revenus pour pouvoir subvenir a ses besoins de mère  de famille et éviter  la dépendance vis-à-vis de son mari. Elle est mariée  et mère  de 8 enfants dont l’âge  varie entre 5 et 28 ans. Elle est devenue sociétaire  de la caisse de Bambilor depuis octobre 2009. Compte tenu de la rentabilité  de son activité ses bénéfices  constants lui ont permis d’acquérir quelques biens matériels  tels que réfrigérateur, téléviseur, etc.  Elle sollicite un crédit de 500 000 frs qui sera destines a l’achat de légumes  et d’huile pour renforcer son commerce et accroitre ses bénéfices. L’acquisition de ce crédit pourra lui permettre  de tendre vers l’autonomie financière.
texts.en:
Mrs. Sadio S. is a woman in her forties whose business is selling vegetables. She has been doing this at the Bambilor market for five years. She has chosen this income-generating activity in order to help meet her needs as the mother of a family and avoid being dependent on her husband. She is married and the mother of eight children ranging from five to 28 years of age. She has become a member of the Bambilor credit union in October 2009. The income derived from her commercial activity has allowed her to acquire such items as a refrigerator, TV set, etc. She is requesting a credit of 500,000 West African Francs, which will allow her to purchase vegetables and oil in order to strengthen her business and increase her revenue. This credit will help her advance towards financial independence.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing business capital

loans.name: Aderoju

texts.en:
Aderoju sells medicine for a living. She loves her business because of the opportunity it gives her to interact with her customers. She hopes to grow her business to become larger and more profitable. She is requesting a loan of N50,000 to purchase more medications to sell. Aderoju is 32 years old and married, with 2 children. Her children are still young and they attend school. Her husband also works to support their home. 

Aderoju says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more medicine to sell

loans.name: Joan

texts.en: Joan is a 25-year-old single mother to one child aged one year. She lives in Hoima, Uganda where she operates a clothing shop. She looks after her child and together they reside in a rented house. She sells clothes for men and women, bags, and shoes. She has been operating the clothing business for 3 years now. She has come far; having started selling clothes in the Central Market in an open area, she now has a shop. She dreams of constructing her own residential house and driving a car one day. This is her first loan from Hofokam and she intends to use the funds for buying clothes, shoes and bags for reselling.

loans.use: buying clothes, shoes and bags for reselling.

loans.name: Henrietta

texts.en:
Henrietta S. is 33 and married with 1 child (8 years old).  She owns a business venture, planting & harvesting taro for sale.  Henrietta has many years of experience in this business.  Henrietta needs a loan of WST $2500 to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 500 talas or US $208 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2006, Henrietta joined SPBD.  This is her 5th loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Henrietta's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  
http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives

loans.name: Siga

texts.fr: Siga N. est une femme de 58 ans, elle est divorcée et vit seule. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de DIAMAGUENE depuis le 22 octobre 2007 et a 5 fois de suite bénéficié de crédit. Elle est vendeuse de mil et d'arachides, son nouveau prêt lui permettra de renforcer son approvisionnement en marchandises et prétendre à des bénéfices plus importants afin de pouvoir assurer son auto-prise en charge.
texts.en:
Siga N. is a 58-year old woman who is divorced and lives alone. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois in DIAMAGUENE since 22nd October 2007 and has benefited from five consecutive loans. She sells millet and peanuts. Her new loan will allow her to build up her stock of goods and aspire to higher profits so that she can take care of herself financially.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Develop and promote her income-generating activity

loans.name: Pacencia

texts.en:
Pacencia B. joined Ahon sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI) because she wanted to have her own business, since her husband's income is not enough to sustain the daily needs of their family. She and her husband aim to use Kiva loans to develop a stable business so they can support the daily needs of their family.

Pacencia would like to receive a loan to purchase inventory to continue her sewing business including cotton fabrics and other materials needed in her business. As a member of ASHI, a Kiva micro-finance partner in the Philippines, Pacencia is thankful for access to loans to support her dreams.

With the support of ASHI and Kiva, Pacencia is optimistic that her sewing business will produce a steady income to improve her economic stability and her family’s quality of life. Her longterm dreams are to continue supporting her children and grandchildren as well as to build a stronger home that can withstand flooding common in her province. She also dreams of owning a successful tailoring shop five years from now so that she can give employment to others in her village, specially her relatives.

loans.use: To pay for cotton fabrics and other materials needed in her sewing business

loans.name: Richard

texts.fr:
jeune homme homme de 45 ans celibataire et pere de 3 enfants allant de 15 ans a 5 ans,a commence cette activite depuis 10 ans avec un seul carton de viande arriere ; aujourd'hui il vend 12 a 13 cartons par semaines de differents produits de sa boucherie, il a recette journaliere de 50.000f a 70.000f par jour.
Avec ce pret il veut  renforcer son stock en achetant meme les produits qu'il n'a pas comme le cotis de porcs,cartons de saucissons, viande de moutons, et s'approvisionne dans les grands chambre froide de la capitale et de Pointe Noire.
Il a des grandes ambitions ouvrir a la longue une grande boucherie ou les desirs de ses clients seront satisfaits.Tres aimable , tout le monde le connait dans le marche ou il exerce , fait preuve d'une bonne moralite et est entrain de se battre pour amener ses enfants dans des bonnes ecoles et construire une maison pour sa famille.
texts.en:
A young single 45 year old man and father of 3 children from 15 to 5 years old. He started this business 10 years ago with a single carton of meat; today he sells 12 to 13 cartons per week of different items from his butcher's shop. His daily income is from 50.000f to 70.000. WIth this loan he would like to increase his back stock and even but some items he currently doesn't carry such as pork chops, boxes of sausages, lamb and get his supplies from the large cold rooms in the capitol and Pointe Noire. In the long term he wishes to open a larger butchers shop where all his clients needs can be met. He is very likable and well known by everyone in the market where he works. He has proven his good morals he is currently fighting to enroll his kids in good schools and build a house for his family.

Translated from French by Colleen Creegan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of cartons of meat, beef, pork and sausages

loans.name: Camino Al Exito Group

texts.es:
La  alcancía comunal denominado “Camino al éxito” está ubicado en la zona D. Ansieta Alta, en el distrito D. El Agustino, se encuentra  representado por la señora  Rubí, y está conformada por 11 socios que radican en dicha zona. Rubí tiene 48 años D. edad, es casada, tiene 4 hijos D. los cuales uno está en la universidad y otro se encuentra en edad académica, el negocio al cual se dedica es la confección D. chalecos, buzos, faldas, blusas entre otros, desD. hace tres años, decidió incursionar en este negocio porque tuvo la oportunidad D. estudiar costura en una capilla cerca a su domicilio.
Trabajan con EDAPROSPO – prosperidad desD. hace 3 años, nuestros socios se dedican a diferentes actividades como la venta D. comida rápida en los mercados, otros socios a la venta D. jugos, golosinas y otros socios a la venta D. ropa; con el reciente préstamo otorgado, la señora Rubí comprara materiales para confeccionar (tela polar, hilos agujas, etc.), todos los demás socios incrementaran su capital para así obtener una mayor productividad, mejor posesión en el mercado y captar mayores clientes. Los socios tienen grandes sueños y metas y se encuentran, muy agradecidos con la institución por todo el apoyo brindado y se comprometen a cumplir con los pagos, seguir trabajando y no defraudarlos. (niños en la foto hijos D. las socias).
texts.en:
The Camino al exito (Road to success) community outreach project is located in Ansieta Alta, an area in the district of El Agustino. The group has 11 members, all from the area, and is represented here by Rubi. Rubi is 48 years old and married with 4 children, one at university and one still school aged. She has operated a business for three years, making and selling hats, sweaters, skirts and blouses among other things. She decided to pursue this line of work after she had the opportunity to learn tailoring at a local church. They have worked with EDAPROSPO for 3 years. The members operate a range of businesses: sales of prepared food, juices, sweets, and clothes. Rubi is buying, with a recent loan, materials (fabric, thread, needles, etc.) to make the products she sells. The other members will increase their capital so that they become more productive or gain a better position in the market or capture more customers. The members have big dreams and goals and they are very grateful to the institution for the help it provides them. All are committed to repaying their loans, continuing their businesses and acting in good faith. (The children in the photo are children of the members.)

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes was born 1970 and is married with three children: the first one is 14, the next is 12 and the last one is 10 years old. Agnes's husband is an accountant in the private sector.

Agnes, herself, is a nurse, the reason why she has created her dispensary. This daily activity is fruitful for her because, with the income, she can sort out some family problems like her children’s school fees and their other basic needs.

Agnes is now requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to buy some medical equipment for her dispensary. This loan will be important for her and her community because she will be able to give a good quality of service.

With the extra money, Agnes will buy her own house.

loans.use: To expand her business by buying some medical equipment

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
Clarita E. is from the village of Brgy. Mabasa, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 59 years old. Clarita is married and has 4 adult-aged children. To make a living, Clarita owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Clarita has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Clarita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Clarita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 18000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Clarita is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This loan will be the 7th loan taken out by Clarita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

location.town: Brgy. Mabasa, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Ester

texts.en: Ester F. is a 53-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating a general-store business. She lives in Brgy. Pugalo, Alcoy, Cebu. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2007 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general-store business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 9,000 Philippine pesos (PHP). Ester is now borrowing PHP 10,500 so that she could buy additional stock to sell in her general store. This will be her seventh loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP10,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Ester aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means "honorable") way. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon. Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase of more stock to sell

loans.name: Marina Luz

texts.en:
Marina is a 43-year-old single mother of three who lives in Santa Ana with her son (two of her three children are adults). Marina has been running a sewing business for the past three years. Marina makes bags, pants, children´s pyjamas, shirts for men and women as well as uniforms for gymnasts. She wakes up early every day so she can carry out the domestic tasks of cooking and cleaning before starting to sew. After she has taken care of household jobs, she starts to sew until her daughter arrives later on in the day. When her daughter arrives, Marina takes a break from sewing.

Marina has been hamstrung due to her inability to secure working capital. This loan will help to address this problem. Marina plans to use this loan to buy materials needed for sewing her products. Marina says her main goal is to increase her workload. She would like to seek out new clients and increase the number of orders she receives.

loans.use: For the purchase of materials necessary for sewing.

loans.name: Lynnie Marie

texts.en:
Lynnie Marie G. is from the town of Banga. She is 33 years old and married with two school-aged children. To make a living, Lynnie Marie owns a business raising rice. She has been farming for over nine years and she also grows pigs for fattening.

Lynnie Marie joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI and is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase farm supplies including livestock feed. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business and supplement her family's income.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies

loans.name: Rosemarie's Group

texts.en:
Rosemarie E. is from the village of Macabibo Sapang Dalaga Mis. Occ. She is 40 years old. Rosemarie is the group leader of a 4-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Magnolla.

Rosemarie is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Rosemarie owns and operates retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as rice and corn grits, instant noodles, shampoo, soap, and toothpaste. Rosemarie has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Rosemarie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosemarie is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte, and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation.  Because manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template to help its Field Partners continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Yasmeen's Group

texts.en:
Yasmeen lives in Jaranwala, which is a small city located in the Punjab province of Pakistan and is famous for its agricultural industry. She lives there in a two-room brick house with her family. 

A talented lady, Yasmeen owns and operates her dairy business at home. She has a buffalo from which she gets milk that she sells to her community to earn an income for her family. She takes care of her buffalo by providing timely food and water.
  
Her husband operates a laundry business in the market where he washes his customers' clothes. Yasmeen has four children and all are getting their education. She works very hard to pay their school fees. She wants them to complete their education and become successful in their lives. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for her dairy business. With the loan, she will buy another buffalo to increase the quantity of milk available for selling to more people. She has been doing this business for the past five years and is hopeful that she will get the desired results from this loan investment.
  
She is a new loan applicant of Asasah and this is her 1st loan application. She hopes that it will be a profitable experience for her. 

Note: In the photo, the lady who is holding a book (called the Asasah Passbook) in her hands is Yasmeen.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo for her dairy business

loans.name: Ganhuu

texts.en:
Ganhuu A., age 44, operates an imported clothing items trading business out of a stall in a trade center. She began her business in 2000 after working as a cook in the small cafe. With the loan from XacBank, she was able to build a house for her family. She is a modest and honest woman who is dedicated to repaying her loan on time. She is requesting a 200,000 MNT in order to import a large amount of winter clothing items from China to offer for sale. 	

Ganhuu lives with her husband and four children in the Harhorin, the ancient capital city of Mongolian empire. She and her family live together in a "ger," a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Her oldest son currently lives and studies at university in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The other three children all attend a local secondary school. Her husband owns about 80 livestock and works as a herder in the countryside surrounding their town.

loans.use: To import a large amount of winter clothing items to offer for sale

loans.name: Ursula

texts.es:
Ursula tiene 57 años D. edad, es casada y vive junto a su esposo en el distrito D. Ciudad Eten, una zona que se ha hecho conocida por la elaboración artesanal D. sombreros tejidos a base D. junco. El lugar se encuentra situado a media hora D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo.

DesD. hace 18 años tiene instalado en el mercado D. abastos D. la ciudad D. Monsefú un puesto D. venta D. verduras. Todos los días ofrece a sus clientes una variedad D. legumbres y tubérculos frescos los cuales adquiere en el mercado mayorista D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo. Este negocio es una fuente importante D. ayuda a la familia, ya que lo que su esposo gana como albañil no es suficiente para solventar los gastos familiares. El negocio D. Ursula siempre cuenta con clientes que prefieren su buen trato y amabilidad. 

Ella desea adquirir más mercadería, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1800 nuevos soles. Ursula ya ha tenido un crédito financiado por el fondo Kiva, gracias a este préstamo pudo ampliar su negocio y mejorar su calidad D. vida con las ganancias que obtuvo. Por ello se encuentra bastante agradecida con las personas que colaboraron con ella a través D. Kiva.

Ursula es una mujer bastante trabajadora y entregada a su familia. Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria.
texts.en:
Ursula is 57 years old. She is married and lives together with her husband in the district of Ciudad Eten, an area which has become known for its production of handmaD. straw hats. The area is located half an hour from the city of Chiclayo.

For the past 18 years, she has operated a sales stand selling vegetables in the supply market of the city of Monsefú. Every day, she offers her customers a variety of leafy and root vegetables, which she buys at the wholesale market in the city of Chiclayo. This business is an important source of help for her family, since what her husband earns as a mason is not sufficient to cover the family's expenses. Ursula's business always has customers who prefer her for her friendliness and good service. 

She would like to acquire more merchandise, and for this reason she has decided to request a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1800 Peruvian new soles. Ursula has already had a loan financed by the Kiva fund; thanks to this loan she was able to expand her business and improve her quality of life with the profits she obtained. Because of this, she is very grateful to all of the people who have supported her through Kiva. 

Ursula is a woman who is very hard-working and very devoted to her family. Her greatest desire is to keep growing as an entrepreneur.

loans.use: Buying merchandise to expand her business

loans.name: Elizabeth Wambui

texts.en:
Elizabeth has been selling clothes in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last four years. She is a 52-year-old married lady.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by her friend and this will be her fourth loan. She paid her previous loan of Kshs 35,000 in full and in good time. She plans to use this loan to boost her boutique shop stock by buying new clothes for sale during the festive season, and also to engage in horticultural farming.

In the future, she hopes to expand her boutique business and also adopt modern methods of farming, e.g., using green houses.

loans.use: To stock clothes for sale, and start horticultural farming

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina M. is from the village of Talisay, Gingoog City. She is 38 years old. Gina is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods and junk foods in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately $230 a month for these activities.

In 2008, Gina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. 

Gina is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like biscuits and snack foods. This will be her 5th loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like biscuits and snack foods

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 34-year-old single man from Lebanon. He lives on his own. He has been working in agriculture for more than 12 years. In 2000, he purchased his own private land and started cultivating it to produce vegetables. He sells his produce in his town and surrounding areas. 

Today, he is requesting a loan of $1000 from Kiva's partner, Ameen s.a.l., to get essential tools to improve his work and increase his productivity and sales.

loans.use: To buy essential tools

loans.name: Pong

texts.en: Pong M., 29, is married and resides with her two children in Kampong Chnang province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. M. sells groceries, earning an income of USD 3 per day to help cover the family expenses. Each month, the family has to spend USD 79 on food and USD 18 on the other necessary expenses. M. is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase a motorbike for family use. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva’s partner.

loans.use: Buy a motorbike for family use

loans.name: Georgina Raquel

texts.es: La Sra. Georgina Raquel V. U. ella es trabajadora activa de la empresa “CEMEX” desempeñándose como Cajera tiene  tres años  de trabajar para esta institución es casada actualmente tiene un hijo en edad escolar. Ha tenido  dos créditos con CEPRODEL y cada  uno lo ha   realizado para la compra de materiales de construcción como Arena, Cemento, Piedra, Piedrín, Bloques etc. Para ampliar y mejorar su casa de habitación, los cuales los créditos con ceprodel le ha beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esta manera ella ha  mejorado su condición de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Sra. Georgina Raquel V. U. is an active employee of the CEMEX Company where she has worked as a cashier for the past three years. She is married and currently has a child who is of school age. Georgina has received two loans from CEPRODEL and each one was used to buy construction materials such as sand, cement, stone, gravel, blocks, and other items to expand and improve her house.

The loans from CEPRODEL have been a great benefit in helping her improve the living conditions for herself and her family.

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to expand & improve her home

loans.name: Chean

texts.en: Chean S. is a 48-year-old married mother. She and her husband own a medium-sized kiosk next to their house in the village, where they provide bicycle and motor repairing services. The couple repairs vehicles for people who are passing in and out of the province. In addition, Chean S.’s husband buys animals from the villagers, fattens them for a while and then sells them for a profit. Because selling livestock is the main source of income for this family, Chean S. requested a loan for her husband to buy an extra cow to sell.

loans.use: To buy an extra cow to sell

loans.name: Edson

texts.en:
Edson is a married man who lives in a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. His greatest monthly expense is rent bills. He has operated a retail shop for the past two years, selling to local residents. The high cost of transporting commodities in his business is the major challenge Edson confronts. Nonetheless, he hopes to expand his business and sell wholesale in the future.

Edson decided to join Yehu because of the efficiency of its loan products, and with the Kshs 20,000 loan he wants to purchase bundles of maize flour, sugar and cooking oil.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of maize flour, sugar and cooking oil.

loans.name: Milagrosa

texts.en:
Milagrosa is a 42-year-old woman living in the town of Sto. Niño, South Cotabato, with her family. She is engaged in a farming and hog-raising business. She plants and harvests rice crops that she sells to her town's market. The pigs she raises are for fattening and sale also. Milagrosa does her best to sustain her family.

Milagrosa's loan will be used to purchase seed, fertilizers and pig feed. She wishes to have a stable business.

loans.use: to purchase seed, fertilizers and pig feed.

loans.name: Mouhamad

texts.en:
Mouhamad is a 45-year-old married man and the father of three. He owns a shop selling underwear and pajamas. Mouhamad lives in Tyre and opened his store in 1990. His business is located in a profitable region and he is able to obtain good sales figures. In the beginning, Mouhamad encountered difficulties expanding his shop but managed to overcome them. 

This is Mouhamad's fourth loan. He reports that the previous ones helped him develop his business and augment his income. He is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua to increase his capital for the spring and summer seasons. In the future, Mouhamad wishes to expand even more and open a larger shop.

loans.use: To buy new spring and summer collection in good prices

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN MARTIN DE ZURITE”; Este banco está ubicado en el Poblado de Zurite,  provincia de Anta y  departamento de Cusco.

La Sra. Josefina, es conviviente y tiene 30 años de edad,  tiene 2 hijos de 8 y 1 años y 8 meses; La socia se dedica al negocio minorista de compra y venta de animales menores, la socia compra cuyes, pollos y todo tipo de aves de corral, la socia se encarga de comprar los animales cuando son bebes los cría y alimenta con comida balanceada, una ves que estos alcanzan su madures, ella los vende al por mayor, estos se reproducen y así se genera la ganancia, la socia desea comprar 20 pollos y otro tanto de cuyes para la crianza, alimentación, reproducción y venta final al por mayor de los más adultos, ella los vende en la feria del pueblo y también distribuye en los diferentes negocios, la socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de animales menores.

La socia valora y agradece el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas de forma disciplinada.
texts.en:
Josefina is a member of the "SAN MARTIN DE ZURITE” community bank which is located in the town of Zurite, in Anta province, in Cusco department.

Josefina is 30 years old, lives with her partner, and has two children aged 8 and 1 year and 8 months.  Josefina buys and sells animals.  She buys guinea pigs, chickens and other kinds of poultry.  She buys the animals when they are babies, raises them, feeds them with balanced animal feed and then, once they have grown, she sells them wholesale.  The animals reproduce and thereby make her a profit.  Josefina would like to buy 20 chickens and 20 guinea pigs to raise, feed, breed and finally sell the oldest animals wholesale.  She sells her animals in the town market and also distributes them to different businesses.  She is requesting this loan to invest in buying young animals.

Josefina appreciates the loan that she has been granted and is grateful for it.  She pledges to make her repayments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to invest in buying animals

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 38 years old and married with 3 children.  She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 17,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like milk, candies, groceries, etc. in her sari-sari (variety) store.

Mary Jane has borrowed and repaid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from buying and selling rice grains.

Mary Jane aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is 27 years old, and married with three children. She runs a retail shop. In addition, she provides tailoring services to supplement her income. She has sustained her business for ten years because of her good customer service. In the future, she hopes to grow the business into wholesale. She has requested 20,000 Kes to buy sugar, rice and corn flour.

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice and corn flour.

loans.name: Chhen

texts.en:
Chhen, 53 years old, and her husband, Meas, 70 years old, are both in the photo above. This couple plants rice on their own farmland and they also sell many kinds of goods in front of their house. The family typically generates a revenue of US $3 each day.

The couple has five children; three are single and two are married. Three of their children are employed in various jobs. One of their children will be married soon and Chhen does not have enough money for the party. Therefore, she is applying for a loan to add to her current savings to hold a wedding party for her son.

loans.use: to hold a wedding party for her son.

loans.name: Bitariho

texts.fr: Bitariho est client d’ACB dépuis 2009, il est marié, il a 45 ans, il a 10 enfants entre 3 mois et 18 ans  et 8 enfants vont à l’école, il a 3 personnes en charge, il est ne  au RDC(République Démocratique du Congo) mais il a nationalite Rwandais.il a niveau  de 3 ans des études secondaire. C’est son quatrième  cycle de  prêt avec ACB, et il n’a aucun difficultés attendus de non-remboursement .Il va utilise le prêt pour acheter 5 sacs de ciments ,30planches de rives, 30 triplex ,2 portes, 10 kgs des clous. Sa stratégie pour la croissance  de l’affaire est augmentée la capacité du busines et investir pour des maisons à louer. Dans l’avenir il voudrait construire d’autres maisons dans les différents milieux, et il voudrait construire des maisons pour ses enfants.il possède aussi un atelier de couture.
texts.en: Bitariho  has been a client of ACB since 2009. He is 45 years old, married,  and has 10 children ranging from three months to 18 years of age. 8 of his children go to school. He has three other dependents. He is born in RDC (the Democratic Republic of Congo), but has Rwandan nationality. He has finished three years of high schools. This is his fourth loan cycle with ACB, and he has had no problems with payment. He will use this loan to buy five bags of cement, 30 fascia boards, 30 triple-ply boards, two doors, and10 kgs of nails.  His business strategy is investing in houses  to rent out. In the future he would like to build  more houses in  various neighborhoods, and also houses for his children. He also owns a tailor’s shop.

loans.use: to buy five bags of cement, 30 fascia boards, 30 triple-ply boards, two doors, and 10 kgs of nails.

loans.name: Rosa Elvira

texts.es:
La Señora. Rosa es socia del banco comunal Las Américas, vive por el Sector de Tutuplai Chico lugar que cuenta con grandes lugares verdes y naturaleza, su gente se dedica a la agricultura, cría de animales y muchos salen a la ciudad de Cuenca a laborar en diferentes actividades.

Doña Rosa tiene 41 años, es casada y ha concebido 6 hijos de 20, 18, 16, 14, 13 y 10 años de edad, sus primeros 4 hijos trabajan y le ayudan económicamente, sus dos últimos hijos estudian en una escuelita de la comunidad. Su esposo labora en la área de la construcción como albañil, con el trabajo conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia.
 
La Señora Rosa se dedica a la limpieza de casas, esta actividad la desempeña desde que tenía 10 años de edad. En su casa se dedica a la cría de vacas, cerdos, gallinas y cuyes que son para su consumo y para la venta.

Este es su segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y  lo va a invertir en la compra de toda clase de víveres ya que va a poner una tienda de comestibles en su casa.

Su meta sacar adelante  su tienda.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the Las Américas Communal Bank.  She lives in the Tutupali Chico Sector, an area with an abundance of verdant lands and nature.  Its people work in agriculture and raise animals, Many go to the city of Cuenca to work in various jobs.  

Rosa is 41 years old, married, and has 6 children- ages 20,18,16,14,13, and 10.  Her oldest 4 children work and help her financially.  Her two youngest attend the neighborhood school.  Her husband works in construction as a bricklayer.  Working together as husband and wife, they have built their own home.  

Rosa cleans houses, a job she has been doing since the age of 10.  At her home, she raises cows, pigs, hens, and guinea pigs for consumption as well as for sale.

This is her second loan with the communal bank and she will invest the funds in the purchase of all types of food as she is going to set up a grocery store in her home.  Her goal is to start up her store

loans.use: to purchase general foods.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en: Elena is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 1 child. Elena has been raising pigs for 1 year. She has requested a loan of PHP 11,000 to buy pig feed for the young and mother pigs. Elena has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Elena hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy pig feed

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es: Rosa Maria: D. 26 años D. edad y tiene 4 hijos ella se dedica a la venta D. animales para crianza como pollos y cerdos, ella nos cuenta que se dedica a esta actividad desD. ya hace varios años, ella dice que Gracias a Dios ella a tenido la oportunidad D. mantener su negocio y que dia a dia ba creciendo por eso ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra D. animales, tales como cerdos, pollos. ella espera que fape le pueda dar la oportunidad D. el credito ya que es la forma conque ella pueD. aumentar sus ventas.y D. la misma forma darles un mejor futuro a sus hijos.
texts.en: Rosa Maria: she is 26 and has 4 children. She sells animals for raising, such as chickens and hogs. She tells us that she has done this work for several years. She says that, thanks to God, she has had the opportunity to maintain her business and that it is growing day by day. For this reason she is requesting a loan for the purchase of animals, such as hogs and chickens. She hopes that FAPE will be able to give her the opportunity to have this loan, since it will allow her to increase her sales and give her children a better future.

loans.use: to purchase chickens and hogs for raising.

loans.name: Ategbeh Town Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the "Ategbeh Town" group. They are small-scale businesspeople based in Waterloo, a small town near Freetown city. They are seeking a loan of 4,300,000 Leone (SLL) from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, they will be able to add more goods to their respective businesses, make more profit, and consequently improve on their living conditions. 

The leader of this group is Mamusu. Mamusu is 33; she was born in a village called Banta. Currently, she resides in Waterloo together with her husband and four children. Her husband is a businessman and her children are attending primary and secondary schools. Mamusu has been a businesswoman for 12 years now. She sells rice. With her share of this loan, she is going to buy rice and palm-oil in bulk in order to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy rice and palm-oil in bulk to expand her business

loans.name: Telma Elizabeth

texts.es: Telma Elizabeth de veinte y seis años de edad, habita en casa propia con su esposo quien es empleado y su querida hija. Ella es una mujer emprendedora la cual trabaja duramente para colaborar con los ingresos del hogar ayudando a su esposo y poder sacar adelante a su familia. Telma posee una pequeña tienda en la cual vende granos básicos y bebidas. Además posee una tortillería en la cual trabaja constantemente para tener listas las ricas tortillas que son demandadas para el almuerzo y cena. Sueña con dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida, pero para  esto necesita un poco mas de dinero y la única forma de tenerlo es trabajando duramente. Esto es lo que la ha motivado a solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL con el fin de abastecerlo y poder satisfacer a una mayor demanda. Con el crédito piensa comprar artículos como: arroz, frijoles, maíz, bebidas, gas propano, etc. De esta manera espera lograr su sueño y dar a su familia todo lo que necesite.
texts.en: Telma Elizabeth, 27, lives in her own home with her husband, who is employed, and her darling daughter. She is an enterprising woman who works hard to contribute to the income for their home, helping her husband and being able to get her family ahead. Telma has a small store where she sells basic goods and sodas. She also sells tortillas and works constantly to always have her delicious tortillas ready, which are in great demand at lunch and dinner time. She dreams of giving her family a better quality of life, but for that she needs a little bit more money and the only way to get it is to work hard. This is what has motivated her to ask for a loan from INTEGRAL so that she can stock her store and satisfy a greater demand. With the loan she will buy things like rice, beans, corn, drinks, propane gas, etc. This is how she hopes to achieve her dream and give her family everything that they need.

loans.use: to buy items like rice, beans, corn, drinks, propane, etc.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria is 42 years old and is a married woman with 3 children aged 17, 14, and 12. She is a farmer and owns a piece of farmland in Banga, South Cotabato. She has been growing rice crops for 17 years.  Gloria earns about 9000 PHP per month doing this farming. She plans to use her loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. She hopes to continue earning from her farm.

loans.use: purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Nola

texts.es: Nola, de 38 años es una mujer admirable. Está casada desde hace 7 años con Arturo, su esposo, producto de su amor nació Jhems, su hijo; al que cuida en una casa alquilada; ubicada en la ciudad de Tarma. Su vida se centra en mantener la armonía familiar, ama a su hijo y a su esposo quienes son su razón para seguir adelante. Hace algunos años comenzó a ejercer la profesión de obstetra en un puesto de salud de la localidad de Acobamba, donde recibe un sueldo mensual por su servicio. Gusta de atender a las futuras madres y brindarles todo el cuidado posible; además recibe el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica al trasporte público en las rutas Tarma-Acobamba, con lo que pueden salir adelante, ya que ambos apoyan en la economía del hogar. “Mis padres son agricultores, por eso yo también heredé ese oficio”, menciona Nola mientras cuenta con detalle que en sus tiempos libres, se dedica a sembrar alimentos de temporada en los terrenos agrícolas de sus padres. Con su trabajo y dedicación logró adquirir un auto y pagar los estudios de su hijo. Ahora desea seguir sembrando y juntar mayor capital de trabajo. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen de Fátima” y este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde espera del apoyo de todos ustedes para lograr sus objetivos. Además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Nola comenzará a sembrar en esta temporada maíz; por ello de recibir su apoyo invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de fertilizantes naturales para comenzar con éxito su próxima siembra.
texts.en:
38-year-old Nola is an admirable woman.  She has been married to her husband Arturo for seven years and their son Jhems was born as a product of their love.  She cares for her son in a rental house which is located in the city of Tarma.

Nola's life centers around maintaining family harmony.  She loves her son and her husband who are her reason for getting ahead in life.  Some years ago, Nola started working as an obstetrician at a health clinic in the town of Acobamba.  She receives a monthly salary for her service.  Nola enjoys working with future mothers, providing them with all the care she can.  She also receives support from her husband who provides a public transport service on the Tarma-Acobamba route.  They are able to get ahead in life because they both support their household financially.  "My parents are farmers and this is why I also inherited this business" says Nola, who she tells us in detail about how she spends her free time growing seasonal food on her parents' farmland.  Through her work and commitment, Nola has managed to buy a car and pay for her son's education.  Now she would like to continue growing her crops and putting together more working capital.

Nola is a member of the "Virgen de Fátima" community bank and this is her first loan from MFP.  She hopes to receive your support so that she can achieve her goals.  For her part, she pledges to be punctual in making her loan repayments.  This season, Nola will start sowing corn.  With your support, she will invest the money she has requested in buying natural fertilizers so that she can make a successful start to her upcoming sowing season.

loans.use: to buy natural fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase irrigation pipes.

loans.name: Maria Angela

texts.es:
María, vive con sus tres hijos, ella se dedica a vender pan de una panadería (pan francés, dulce de torta, budín) todos los días, desde la una de la tarde hasta las seis de la tarde en el centro de la ciudad.
El préstamo lo necesita para comprar pan y poner una mini tienda con productos de primera necesidad  (arroz, frijoles, azúcar y  maíz), con el propósito de tener el negocio en la casa y obtener un nuevo ingreso, ayudando tambien a los vecinos de la zona para que puedan comprarle articulos de primera necesidad.
El sueño de María es tener su tienda y mejorar su casa, para que su familia viva más segura y mejorar su calidad de ellos.
texts.en:
María lives with her three children.  She sells bread from a bakery (French bread, cake, bread pudding) every day in the center of the city, from 1 in the afternoon until 6 in the afternoon.

She needs the loan to buy bread and open a small store to sell necessities (rice, beans, sugar, and corn).  She plans to have the business in her house and have additional income, also helping the neighbors in the area so they can buy necessities from her.

María's dream is to have a store and improve her house so her family lives more securely and to improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy bread, rice, beans, sugar, and corn.

loans.name: Jean Claude

texts.en: Jean Claude is single. He works as a repairman for machines, radios, and television. He would like a loan to upgrade his business and buy more tools and equipment. Claude will use the profits to establish new products and create a savings for his future. He dreams to become the best entrepreneur.

loans.use: To buy more tools used for repairing.

loans.name: Kulnur's Group

texts.en:
Kulnur is the leader of this group. She is 50 and married to a taxi driver. With her husband, she has raised four sons and two daughters. Their two younger sons study at school and the other children are married and live separately with their families. 

Kulnur is engaged in cattle breeding; she started this activity 30 years ago with an initial investment of 3000 Kyrgyzstan soms (KGS). She has a lot of experience in this activity, and with the profits gained from selling the dairy products and reselling animals Kulnur was able to purchase a vehicle for her husband. 

With money received from this loan, she wants to increase the number of cattle. In the future she plans to finish the construction of a new house.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase cattle.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children, two of whom go to school. She takes care of one additional family member, her mother. 

Susan has a restaurant at the market. She has rental houses as her other source of income. Susan works seven days a week. She has been in this business for the last six years. She has requested a loan of 500,000 Uganda shillings (UGX) from MCDT SACCO to buy rice, bunches of bananas, beef, and sweet potatoes.

Her major business challenges are transportation, defaulters, and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations are to own a fully stocked hotel and also to build more rental rooms. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses are school fees and paying utility bills.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas, rice, beef, and sweet potatoes.

loans.name: Liverata

texts.es: Liverata, de 43 años es una mujer responsable. Vive en compañía de Julián su esposo; ambos tienen 5 hijos, pero solo viven con 3 de ellos en su casa propia, ubicada en el caserío de Acolla. Sus 2 mayores hijos se dedican trabajan fuera de la ciudad, uno en el país de Venezuela y el otro en la ciudad de Trujillo al norte del país. Gracias a su trabajó, saco adelante a sus hijos, de los que se siente orgullosa. Su principal actividad económica es la agricultura, con la siembra de papa y hortalizas. Las que lleva 19 años cuidando con mucha sabiduría. Cuenta que con el apoyo de su esposo, también puede criar animales como ovejas y cerdos que vende junto a su cosecha en la feria que se realiza en la ciudad de Jauja, ahí obtienen buenas ganancias, sobre todo porque su esposo aprovecha en sacar una motocarro que tienen para realizar trasporte público entre las calles de la ciudad. Ahora ellos desean mejorar sus ingresos para el futuro de sus hijos menores. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “mujeres luchadora” y este es el tercer crédito con MFP, donde espera del apoyo de todos ustedes para lograr su objetivo. Además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas, pues su asociación lo integran personas responsables y solidarias. Liverata de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de fertilizantes naturales para su próxima siembra de habas.
texts.en:
Liverata, age 43, is a very responsible woman.  She lives with her husband, Julián.  They have five children, but they only live with three of them in their own house in the rural community of Acolla.  Their two oldest children work outside of the city.  One works in Venezuela, and the other works in the city of Trujillo to the north of the country. 

Thanks to her work, she got her children ahead, and she is proud of them.  Her main business activity is farming; she grows potatoes and vegetables.  She has very astutely been taking care of her crops for 19 years.  She says that with her husband’s support she is also able to raise animals like sheep and pigs.  She sells them together with the harvest at the fair in the city of Jauja.  They get good earnings there mainly because her husband makes the most of it by taking his “motocarro” (three wheeled motorized vehicle) to provide public transportation among the streets of the city.

Now they wish to improve their income for their minor children’s future.  She belongs to the “Mujeres Luchadora” (Tenacious Women) communal bank.  This is her third loan with MFP.  She hopes for support from all of you to achieve her objective.  She pledges to be punctual with her payments.  Her association is comprised of responsible and supportive people.

Upon receiving your support she will use the requested money to buy natural fertilizers for her next planting of beans.

loans.use: to buy sacks of natural fertilizers.

loans.name: Mahoton Pascal

texts.fr: Mahoton Pascal est âgé de 55 ans et est marié à une vendeuse du nom de Yvette. Le couple a huit enfants tous scolarisés dont six restent encore à leur charge. Mahoton Pascal vit ensemble avec sa femme et ses enfants. Mahoton Pascal n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges familiales. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de sa famille, Mahoton Pascal mène comme activité depuis trente huit ans environs, la culture des céréales (maïs et haricot) et des légumineuses (piment et tomate) qu’il vend dans sa région et dans une ville du Bénin. Parallèlement à cette activité Mahoton Pascal fait l’élevage des porcs. C'est dans sa région que Mahoton Pascal exerce ses activités. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle, Mahoton Pascal sollicite un cinquième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Son ambition est d’accroître le niveau de son activité. Les quatre premiers crédits reçus antérieurement par Mahoton Pascal ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: Mahoton Pascal is 55 years old and married to a salesperson names Yvette. They have eight children, all school educated, six of whom are still living at home. Mahoton Pascal lives with his wife and children. Mahoton Pascal did not go to school. The couple meet the family's various expenses between them. To cover his needs and those of his family, Mahoton Pascal has been a farmer for approximately thirty eight years, growing cereals (corn and beans) and vegetables (peppers and tomatoes) which he sells in his local area and in a town in Benin. Alongside this activity, Mahoton Pascal also raises pigs. He does all this in his local area. With a view to strengthening his business and better meeting the needs of his customers, Mahoton Pascal is seeking a fifth loan from ALIDé. His goal is to grow the scale of his business. The four loans previously received by Mahoton Pascal have all been repaid.

loans.use: to buy food products for farming (peppers, tomatoes, beans and corn).

loans.name: Bamco Mujer Hacia El Futuro Group

texts.es:
Doña Denia es la presidenta de Banco Mujer Hacia el Futuro, una mujer con mucho liderazgo, ganas de salir adelante, y ayudar a mujeres de su comunidad. Tiene 49 años, es madre de 7 hijos, todos mayores de edad, y vive actualmente solo con su esposo. Ella es comerciante vende productos por catalogo, cosméticos y perfumes, para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, ya que él trabaja en una pequeña finca bananera propia, y los ingresos que genera son muy pocos. 
El crédito va ser de gran ayuda  para la socia, y va a invertir en la compra de mercadería ya que tiene muchos pedido para esta temporada navideña, y además le permitirá aumentar los ingresos familiares, y mejorar la calidad de vida de ella y su esposo. 
Su meta es que su negocio crezca lo suficiente como para que su esposo deje de trabajar en la finca bananera  y le ayude a ella con las ventas, ya que está muy enfermo. 
Este grupo está compuesto por un total de 11 socias, que realizan diversas actividades agropecuarias y comerciales y van a invertir los créditos en la compra de mercadería y materia prima.
texts.en:
Denia is President of the “Mujer Hacia el Futuro” communal bank.  She’s a woman with good leadership skills and drive to get ahead and help women in her community.  She’s 49 years old and the mother of 7 children, all adults now.  She lives just with her husband now.
