Mary lives in a home that she rents. She has access to electricity and access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include rent, school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy sugar, cooking oil, soap and cooking oil

loans.name: Othman

texts.en:
Othman, from Al Ashrafieh-Amman, is an ambitious 22-year-old.  He has his own carpentry business.

Othman began his business as a small carpentry shop to help his father support their family. After a short period of time Othman could buy a bigger shop through his exceptional talent and hard work. 

Othman is requesting a loan of 1500 JD to buy wood and expand his business. He is looking to import wood from outside and sell it locally so that he can help his family financially and provide them with better living conditions.

loans.use: To buy wood and expand his carpentry business

loans.name: Ednita

texts.en: Ednita R. is from the village of Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 48 years old, separated from her spouse and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Ednita owns and operate a direct-sales business selling personal products such as glasses and watches in the local community. Ednita has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2010, Ednita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ednita is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Ednita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water and her greatest monthly expenses are rent and school fees.

For the past three years, Pamela has operated a business selling clothes. She sells retail, going from door to door. Pamela's major business challenge is seasonality. During the rainy winter season, demand for women’s dresses is low in comparison with the hot summer season when demand is very high. 

Pamela decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. She is requesting a loan of 15,000 KES to purchase a bundle of clothing and women’s dresses to sell. In the future, Pamela hopes to own a retail shop.

loans.use: to purchase a bundle clothing and women's dresses

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia Córdova, de 57 años de edad, natural del distrito de San Miguel, es madre soltera tiene 03 hijos vive en su casa propia en la comunidad Palmapampa perteneciente al distrito de Samugari. Con mucho esfuerzo Julia, y sus hijos han logrado remover sus tierras para volverlas muy productivas; Julia es agricultora se dedica a cultivar plantaciones de cacao y hojas de coca; que son productos sostenibles para su economía. En tiempos de cosecha Julia tiene que contratar jornaleros para extraer con rapidez los frutos. Viene trabajando 08 años en la agricultura y es conocedora de sus responsabilidades y lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus cultivos ya que depende de eso el ingreso de su economía; considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos desde la chacra hasta la ciudad de san francisco lugar donde le ofrecen mejores precios por cada producto. En adelante, desea comprar nuevas tierras para incrementar sus cultivos. Este es su octavo crédito con MFP, ha sido muy puntual en sus anteriores créditos y espera serlo también ahora. En su banco comunal es una socia muy querida por el resto de los integrantes. Con los 500 nuevos soles solicitados, contratará jornaleros para realizar el desmonte de malezas.
texts.en:
57-year-old Julia Córdova, a native of the district of San Miguel, is a single mother of 3. She lives in her own home in the community of Palmapampa, in the district of Samugari.
Through a lot of hard work, Julia and her children have managed to work the land to be very productive. Julia is a farmer who grows cacao and coca, which are economically sustainable crops. At harvest time, Julia hires labourers to harvest the crops quickly.
She has worked in agriculture for 8 years and knows her responsibilities well. Her favourite part of the work is caring for her crops given that she depends on them for her income. The most difficult part is transporting the produce from the farm to the city of San Francisco, where she can sell for better prices.
In the future she hopes to buy new lands to expand her crops. This is her eighth MFP loan and, having made her previous payments on time, she plans to continue doing so now. In her communal bank, she is well-liked by the other members. With the requested 500 PEN, she will hire labourers to weed her land.

loans.use: Hire labourers to weed her land

loans.name: Digna

texts.en:
Digna D. is from the town of Bunawan. She is 47 years old. Digna is married and has two school-aged children. 

To make a living, Digna plants and harvests rice for sale. Digna also plants and harvests vegetables in her backyard. She works hard to sustain her family.

Digna joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Digna has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Digna is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase seeds and fertilizers. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay for her children's tuition fees.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Job

texts.en: Job is a married man with two children.  He runs a retail shop so as to provide for his family.  He was previously in farming.  He has been engaged in the business for over two years and has been able to add stock to his business using loans from Faulu Kenya.  He hopes to grow his business into a supermarket in the future.  Job has requested 40,000 KES to buy sugar, rice and cooking fat.

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice and cooking fat

loans.name: Salyibubu

texts.en:
Salyibubu T. is 45, married and has four children. She works as a nurse at the hospital and her husband is a crane driver. Salaries of the medical personnel are not high in the rural areas. For this reason, people need to find an additional means of subsistence. 

In 2002, Salyibubu decided to engage in selling meat products at the local market. She started this activity with the initial capital of 20,000 KGS and managed to earn about 16,000 KGS in a month. With the revenues, she was able to pay for the education of her elder daughters. Salyibubu has applied for a loan of 85,000 KGS to purchase 14 sheep. This will allow her to broaden her business and to help in purchasing a flat in Bishkek, the capital city. 


About Bai-Tushum: 

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Margina

texts.en:
Margina is 37 years old and is a married woman with 3 children. Her oldest child is 13 years old.

Margina sells RTW clothes like shirts and jeans. She also sells slippers, cooking pots and pale. She has been in this business for 5 years. She has requested a loan to purchase more items to sell, like shirts and slippers. Margina hopes for her business to grow.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell like shirts and slippers

loans.name: Nadya

texts.es: Nadya tiene 22 años, es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en su propia vivienda junto a su pareja Richard  de 24 años y su querida hija Cledy de 07 años de edad, a quien desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Con mucho esfuerzo Nadya y su pareja Richard han logrado trabajar sus tierras y volverlas muy fructíferas, ella cultiva, cacao, café y hojas de coca, una vez cosechados las lleva a vender hasta los centros de acopio situados en las ciudades de Santa Rosa y San Francisco donde los vende al por mayor. Sus cultivos le han dado los ingresos necesarios para mantenerse, es por eso que desea poner todas sus ganas en sacar adelante este negocio. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus cultivos, donde lleva 06 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos, ya que los sacos que lleva son muy pesados y por lo cual contrata animales de carga como el burro para que se encarguen con el carguio respectivo de los frutos hasta los tendales. Con el crédito solicitado comprará par de carretillas para facilitarse con el traslado de sus productos. En adelante, desea comprar nuevas tierras para así ampliar su producción. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, el préstamo solicitado le será de mucha utilidad y esta contenta con la creación de un banco comunal en su pueblo. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles comprará par de carretillas para facilitarse con el traslado respectivo de sus productos.
texts.en: Nadya is 22 years old and she is a very happy and hardworking woman. She lives in a house that she owns, together with her partner, Richard, who is 24 years old, and her beloved 7-year old daughter, Cledy. She wants to give them both a better quality of life. With a great deal of effort Nadya and her partner, Richard, have worked their land and they have made them very productive. She cultivates cocoa, coffee, and coca leaves. Once the harvest is done she takes the products to the collection centers in the cities of Santa Rosa and San Francisco for wholesale.  Her cultivations have provided her with enough funds to support themselves, which is why she wants to put her best into this business. The thing she most enjoys about her work is caring for her cultivations. She has 6 years in the business. The most difficult part of her work is having to transport her products, especially because the sacks are very heavy and she needs to hire help. She uses donkeys to carry the loads of products to the centers. With the funds that she requests she will purchase wheelbarrows to help transport her products. In the future she wants to buy ore land to increase production. This is her first loan with MFP (Kiva Field Partner). The loan that she requests will be of great help and she is happy with the introduction of the communal bank in her village. With the 1000 nuevos soles she will purchase wheelbarrows to help transport her products.

loans.use: to purchase wheelbarrows to transport her products

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a 39-year-old married woman with two children who are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Lucy has a bakery business in the Philippines. Lucy requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional ingredients for her bakery business.

Lucy has been in this business for five years. In the future, Lucy would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy additional ingredients for her bakery business

loans.name: Mahmasobir

texts.ru: Махмасобир проживает в районе Хуросон. Возраст, 47 лет. Женат. Имеет 5 детей. Жена, домохозяйка. Двое его сыновей находятся на заработках в России. Сам он имеет средне - специальное образование, бухгалтер. По специальности работает 10 лет. Кроме того он занимается животноводством. Разводит скот у себя дома. Он в основном разводит скот в дальнейшем для продажи. Этим видом деятельности занимается 10 лет. Кредит берет для закупа крупнорогатого скота.
texts.en: Mahmasobir lives in Khuroson. He is 47 years old, married, and has five children. His wife is a housewife. Two of his sons are working in Russia. He has a vocational education as a bookkeeper. He has been working in his field for ten years.  Additionally, he works in animal husbandry. He raises cattle at home. He primarily raises cattle for later sale. He has been doing this work for ten years. He is taking out a loan to buy cattle.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Mary Lyn

texts.en:
Mary Lyn is now 31 years old and married with four school-aged children. Mary Lyn is a farmer working in the Philippines and earns PHP 5,000 per month. 

Mary Lyn is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase fertilizers and pesticides. She grows rice and has been doing it for almost eight years.

In the future, Mary Lyn hopes to have a plentiful harvest in order to earn more income to support the education of their children. She hopes that Kiva lenders will continuously assist her in the business to strengthen the source of their income and give their children a brighter future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pesticides

location.town: Brgy. San Fabian, Kayapa, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Delmy Esperanza

texts.es:
Delmy, es madre soltera de tres hijos de 11, 16 y 18 años de edad; Ella es ama de casa y realiza también actividades agrícolas, tiene 10 años de estar sembrando maíz, sus hijos mayores le ayudan a este trabajo, el horario que dedican es de 6:00am a 3:00pm.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de abonos y tratamientos para plagas, con estos materiales iniciara el proceso de siembra, esperando dar un buen cuido y que pueda recibir una sana cosecha.
Su objetivo es tener una fuente de ingreso, por eso se esfuerza a realizar su trabajo, y velar por que sus hijos puedan estudiar.
texts.en:
Delmy is a single mother of three children who are 11, 16 and 18 years of age.  She is a housewife and also farms.  She’s been farming corn for ten years.  Her older children help her with the work.  Their work schedule is 6am to 3pm.

She is asking for a loan to buy manure and insecticide.  She will be able to start planting with these supplies hoping to provide good care so that she can reap a healthy harvest.

Her goal is to have a strong source of income and this is why she strives to do her work and to see to her children’s schooling.

loans.use: to buy manure and insecticide.

loans.name: Rozan

texts.en:
Rozan is a 20-year-old lady who opened a beauty salon two years ago with the support of her husband and after getting lots of training courses to be a hair and make-up stylist.

Although she started at a young age, her talent, ambition and her hard work have led her salon to be one of the successful beauty salons in the area. 

Now Rozan has applied for a loan to add manicure (nail polishing) as one of her new services, so she wants to buy equipment needed to achieve her purpose.

loans.use: To buy nail polishing equipment so she can add this service to her beauty salon.

loans.name: Sop Sokhna Faty Issa Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Sop Sokhna Faty Issa du Banc Villageois Sop Sokhna Awa Balla est créé le 21 septembre 2010, il est composé de onze femmes qui habitent le même quartier et qui sont cousines; elles s'activent depuis longtemps dans le petit commerce.


Madame Momy la responsable est âgée de 35 ans, elle est mariée mère de trois enfants, elle s'active dans le petit commerce de légumes; sur la photo elle est debout à droite habillée en vert.


Elle achéte et revend ses légumes au marché central du village.


Son prêt lui permettra d'acheter périodiquement une bonne quantité et variété de légumes afin de satisfaire la clientèle et se faire beaucoup de revenus.


Elle souhaite avec ses bénéfices attendus augmenter son épargne et se prendre en charge, son mari gère les besoins familiaux.
texts.en:
The Sop Sokna Faty Issa solidarity group of the Sop Sokhna Awa Balla Villageois was created on September 21, 2010. It is composed of 11 women who live in the same neighborhood and are related; they have been working as vendors for a long time.

Ms. Momy, the group’s representative, is 35 years old. She is married and the mother of three. She sells vegetables. On the photo she stands on the right, dressed in a green outfit. She buys and resells vegetables and the central market of their village. Her loan will allow her to keep stocking up on a variety of vegetables in order to meet client demand and have a high sales volume. Thanks to the expected income, she would like to bolster her savings and to cover her personal needs. Her husband takes care of the household expenses.

loans.use: to buy vegetables for resale at the central marketplace

loans.name: Dora Delia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal “SEÑOR DE LOS MILAGROS DE CHIMPAHUAYLLA”; El banco pertenece al distrito de Huanchac, Provincia de Cusco, departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Dora; la socia tiene 30 años; la socia es soltera;  La socia se dedica a la docencia, la socia es docente de profesión y trabaja en el colegio Pachacutec, que está ubicado en el distrito de San Jerónimo, la socia aún no piensa en tener hijos pero si le gustaría en un par de años, la socia disfruta de el poder enseñar a sus alumnos y también de orientarlos para que sean jóvenes íntegros y educados, la socia suele sacar el préstamo para invertir en la compra de diferentes artefactos, como televisores, licuadoras, cocina, entre otros ya que esta independizándose de la casa de sus padres para lo cual ella desea poder invertir en sus cosas personales como muebles y otros, en esta ocasión la socia desea el crédito para comprar un mueble de dormitorio el cual ira pagando poco a poco con su sueldo de docente. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de un mueble de dormitorio.

La socia se muestra muy satisfecha y agradecida por el apoyo que se le brindara mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Dora is a member of the “SEÑOR DE LOS MILAGROS DE CHIMPAHUAYLLA” community bank which is located in Huanchac district, in Cusco province, in Cusco department.

Dora is 30 years old and single.  She is a teacher by profession and works in Pachacutec school which is located in San Jerónimo district.  She still not planning on having children just yet but she would like to in a couple of years.  Dora enjoys teaching her students and also guiding them so that they become upright and educated young people.  She usually takes out loans to invest in buying household items such as a television set, a blender, a stove, etc. as she is becoming independent from her parents and their home and would like to be able to invest in personal items such as furniture, etc.  On this occasion, she would like a loan to invest in buying a piece of bedroom furniture.

Dora is very happy and grateful for the the support that she is receiving.  She pledges to make her loan repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy a piece of bedroom furniture

loans.name: Ablavi

texts.fr:
Ablavi est une femme  âgée de 36 ans. Elle est mariée å un agent de la LONATO. Elle a 04 enfants. 
Ablavi travaille comme revendeuse d’alimentations générales depuis 2003. Elle vend à ses clients à HOUNTIGOME Elle achète les produits à LOME et à ACCRA.
Ablavi a requis son premier cycle de prêt à WAGES afin d’acheter des produits alimentaire(sucre,riz, huile végétale..).
texts.en: Ablavi is a 36-year-old woman who is married to a LONATO representative. She has four children. She has been working as retailer of grocery items since 2003. She makes her sales in HOUNTIGOME. She purchases her supplies from Lomé and from Accra. Ablavi has requested her first loan cycle at WAGES in order to buy supplies (sugar, rice, vegetable oil…)

loans.use: to buy grocery items

loans.name: Yanira Elizabeth

texts.es: Yanira Elizabeth de treinta y un años de edad, reside en su casa con su compañero de vida y su hija de once años de edad. Yanira es una mujer increíble la cual no pierde oportunidad para hacer negocio. Ella se dedica a la venta de calzado. Posee un pequeño puesto en el mercado central de la zona donde ella habita. La ubicación del negocio es muy estratégica ya que se encuentra ubicado en las principales calles del lugar. Además, cuenta con clientela fija ya que por su amabilidad ha sabido ganarse la confianza de muchas personas. Anteriormente recibió crédito de INTEGRAL para invertirlo en su negocio y gracias a esto ha podido mantenerse un paso adelante de la competencia. Es muy responsable y desea poder obtener un nuevo crédito que le permita surtir  su negocio con nueva mercadería de tal manera que le permita atraer a mas clientes demandantes de sus productos. Con el crédito piensa comprar variedad de sandalias para todo género, edad y preferencias.  Confía en Dios que logrará su sueño y podrá dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Yanira Elizabeth, 31, lives in her house with her life partner and their 11 year-old daughter.  Yanira is an amazing woman who never misses an opportunity to do business.  She has a business selling shoes.  She has a small post in the central market in the neighborhood where she lives.  The location of her business is very strategic, since it is located on one of the main streets in the place.  In addition, she has regular customers, because  due to her friendly demeanor, she has known how to gain the trust of many people.  She previously received a loan from INTEGRAL to invest in her business, and thanks to that she has been able to stay one step ahead of the competition.  She is very responsible, and she wants to take a new loan so that she can stock her business with new merchandise.  This way she can attract more customers to purchase her products.  With the loan, she is planning to buy a variety of sandals for all genders, ages and tastes.  She trusts in God that she will achieve her dream so that she can give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a variety of sandals for all genders, ages and tastes

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy candies, chips, biscuits, etc to sell

loans.name: Carmen Ivonne

texts.es:
Carmen, posee una tienda la cual administra desde hace 4 años, vive con sus padres y un hermano, ella es soltera, el negocio fue por iniciativa de sus padres y con su ayuda lo atienden todos los días de 5:00am a 7:00pm; Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de arroz, frijoles, aceite, papel higiénico, detergentes, pastas dentales, entre otros productos que a diario le solicitan los clientes.
Este préstamo le ayudara mucho porque surtirá de mercadería el negocio y podrá ofrecer productos de calidad a los clientes. Su objetivo es permanecer en el negocio, ayudando a sus padres y velando por su bienestar
texts.en:
Carmen has a store which she has managed for four years. She lives with her parents and one brother. She is single, and the business was by initiative of her parents. With their help they are open for business every day from 5 a.m. until 7 p.m. She is seeking a loan to purchase rice, beans, oil, toilet paper, detergents and toothpaste, among other products requested by her customers on a daily basis. 

This loan will help her a lot because it will supply merchandise to the business and she will be able to offer quality products to her customers. Her objective is to remain in business, helping her parents and watching out for their wellbeing.

loans.use: to purchase rice, beans, oil, toilet paper, detergents and toothpaste.

loans.name: Shaymaa

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. She is 28 years old, married and lives with her husband and two children.

Shaymaa has been an owner of a women's beauty salon since 2010, offering hairdressing, makeup, manicures and pedicure. She has good experience in this field, a deep understanding of the local customers, and knows about their needs. She has a good reputation and she is well known in the surrounding areas.

She decided to apply for a $1,800 loan in order to redecorate, paint and renovate her shop. She is aiming to gain more profits to offer her the opportunity to provide a better life for her family as a whole.

loans.use: to redecorate, paint and renovate her shop.

loans.name: Trabajando Para El Futuro Group

texts.es: La Sra. Georgina  es soltera, no tiene hijos y tiene 60 años, actualmente es integrante en la alcancía comunal “Trabajando para el Futuro” grupo  conformado por  7  socios que se dedican a diversas actividades D. comercio. Georgina trabaja desD. hace 15  años en la venta D. abarrotes y condimentos al por mayor, este negocio surge porque ella quería ayudar a sus padres a tener una mejor calidad D. vida ya que ella no tiene hijos, se hizo D. un capital e invirtió en abarrotes con el tiempo su negocio fue creciendo y empezó a vender al por mayor condimentos (ají molido, ajo molido, pimienta en polvo etc.) ,con el tiempo su negocio fue creciendo y se hizo muy conocida ahora cuenta con mayor clientela, gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación a logrado mejores ingresos económicos, ha construido su casa, y su familia cuenta con una mejor calidad D. vida  con el fin D. seguir creciendo a solicitado un nuevo préstamo para comprar mercadería insumos fideos,arroz leche, aji. Sabemos que Georgina cumplirá sus metas con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo y que los préstamos D. Edaprospo le ayudaran.
texts.en:
Georgina is a single woman who doesn't have children and is 60 years old.  She is currently a member of the communal bank "Trabajando para el Futuro" ["Working for the Future"], a group maD. up of 7 partners that carry out various business activities.  

Georgina has been working for 15 years selling wholesale food products and seasonings.  This business came about because she wanted to help her parents to have a better quality of life since she doesn't have children herself.  She got together some capital and invested in food products, and in time her business began to grow. She began to sell wholesale seasonings (such as ground chili pepper, garlic powder, black pepper, etc.) and her business continued to grew and became very well known.  Now it has an even larger clientele, and thanks to her effort and dedication she has achieved better economic earnings. She has built herself a home, and her family has a better quality of life.  

With the objective of continuing to grow, she has requested a new loan in order to purchase merchandise and supplies such as noodles, rice, milk and chili peppers.  We know that Georgina will achieve her goals with a lot of hard work and effort and that the loans from Edaprospo will help her succeed.

loans.use: to purchase supplies (noodles, rice, milk).

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel is 35 years old, married, and blessed with four children. His wife is a housekeeper and his partner in managing their rice farming business. He has been 15 years in this business. He shared that he was only in his twenties when he learned the activities of farming from his parent. Joel did not get a chance to enter college, and that’s why he strives to give the chance to enter college to his children to finish their studies. Joel believes that education is the key to success.

Joel wishes to increase his farm area to gain a higher yield and higher earnings. Due to insufficient funds, he is not able to make his wish a reality. However, he did not lose his hopes of obtaining his wishes someday. He believes that there is always a right time to obtain them in a right way.

Because of the cost of farm supplies like fertilizer, rice seeds, herbicides and insecticides, Joel decided to borrow a loan of PHP27,000 to buy these supplies needed in rice farming, and to pay labor costs.

loans.use: to buy supplies needed in rice farming, and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Pulodoy

texts.ru: Пулодой жительница города Истаравшан. Ей 46 лет. Она вдова. У нее один ребенок, сын. Ее сын на сегодняшний день находится в России. Сама Пулодой семь лет как открыла аптеку. Она имеет медицинское образование. Кредит берет для приобретения медикаментов. После смерти мужа она на работу не выходила. За этот период времени ее аптека опустела. Сейчас Пулодой намерена расширить свою деятельность.
texts.en:
Pulodoy lives in the city of Istaravshan. She's forty-six years old, widowed and a one son. Her son is currently away on employment in Russia. 
Pulodoy has a degree in medicine and opened a pharmacy seven years ago. She's asking for a loan in order to purchase medical supplies. After the death of her husband, Pulodoy took a break from work, and her pharmacy is now empty. Now she wishes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase medical supplies.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine, who lives in Kampala, Uganda, is a married mother of four children, two of whom attend school. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses are school fees and medication.

Josephine has operated a retail shop, open seven days a week, for the last 10 years. She is now requesting a loan of 500000 from MCDT SACCO to buy more sugar, cooking oil, boxes of soap, flour and rice. Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality, and her goals are to expand into a wholesale shop and to educate her children to university level.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, boxes of soap, rice, cooking oil  and maize flour.

loans.name: Sugei

texts.es: Sugei de 36 años de edad es una mujer casada que vive al sur de la ciudad con su esposo y sus dos hijos en las edades de 9 y 15 años. Ella desde hace 8 años arrendó una habitación a  un Bogotano, quien emprendiera una empresa de transporte y  le propusiera trabajar con él en este negocio, pues conocía que Sugei se encontraba estudiando mercadeo. Aunque le fue muy bien decidió abandonar esta actividad  porque su hijo nació con problemas, pero el propietario del negocio, satisfecho con su trabajo,  decidió emprender una sucursal en casa de Sugei, así fué como sugei compró sus equipos, enseres de oficina y se dedicó a venderle el servicio de administración de su empresa de transportes, como hasta la presente y en el cual le ha ido muy bien, pues ha logrado alternarlo con otro de venta de productos, mediante guías especializadas, con el que obtiene buenas ganancias, porque aprovecha el mercado de cada actividad. Su sueño más adelante es adquirir su propio camión de transporte y hacer su casa de dos pisos, para ampliar el negocio. En la actualidad está aplicando a su primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,  mediante el cual comprará un nuevo computador y variedades de productos que vinieron en sus catálogos con descuentos especiales, con ello logará resultados exitosos porque aprovechará la temporada de Diciembre época en la cual hay buen movimiento de dinero.
texts.en:
Sugei is a 36 year old married woman who lives in the south of the city with her husband and two children, aged 9 and 15. 

For 8 years she has been leasing a room to a man from Bogota, who set up a transport business and suggested she work with him, since he knew that Sugei had been studying marketing. Although it went very well, she decided to give up the work because her son was born with special needs. However, the business owner, pleased with her work, decided to set up a branch in Sugei's home. 

This is how Sugei bought her office equipment and started to work providing management services for his transport business, which she still does and has done well in. She now alternates it with selling products, through catalogues, on which she makes a good profit because she makes the most of the market. 

Her dream for the future is to buy her own transport lorry and make her house into two flats so she can expand her business. 

At the moment, she is applying for her first loan with the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, which she will use to buy a new computer and various catalogue products, at special discounted prices. She will achieve excellent results from these as she will make the most of the December season when there is a lot of money changing hands.

loans.use: to buy a new computer and various catalogue products.

loans.name: Aby

texts.fr:
Madame Aby est une femme mariée âgée de 51 ans et mère de 2 enfants. Elle est aussi responsable d'un autre enfant à sa charge.

Elle est membre du banc villageois depuis le 01/09/2008 et fait parti du groupe de solidarité sope Abou. Aby fait du petit commerce dans la vente de tissus et de parfums.

Avec son nouveau prêt de 500000 francs Cfa elle va acheter des rouleaux de tissus et des cartons de parfums destinés à la revente au niveau de ses camarades de banc villageois et de ses amis du quartier.

A l aide de ses bénéfices elle va entamer la construction d'une maison.
texts.en:
Mrs. Aby is a 51-year-old married woman, mother of two children. She is also responsible for another dependent child.

She is a member of the local "Banc Villageois" organization since 1 September 2008, and is part of the Abu sope solidarity group . Aby is a petty trader of fabrics and perfumes.

With her new loan of 500,000 CFA francs she will buy rolls of fabric and boxes of perfume for resale to her fellow "Banc Villageois" members and to neighborhood friends.

Her profits will enable her to begin the construction of a house.

loans.use: buy fabrics and fragrances for resale.

loans.name: Florinda Cruz

texts.es:
La señora Florinda Cruz es casada, tiene 30 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, tiene 1 hijos pequeño, inicio este negocio por iniciativa propia y lleva 7 años de experiencia.

Solicita un préstamo que le servirá para la compra de productos: aguas gaseosas, jugos, fideos, arroz, flijol, comida en lata, lácteos, etc. espera en el futuro tener un negocio grande.
texts.en:
Florinda Cruz is 30 years old and married with a small child. She has not had the opportunity to study, and started this business on her own initiative and has seven years of experience.

She has applied for this loan to purchase products for her store such as carbonated water, juice, noodles, rice, beans, canned food, milk, etc. In future she hopes to expand and own a large business.

loans.use: to purchase goods for her general store

loans.name: Luzmila

texts.es:
Luzmila tiene 53 años es casada, vive con el esposo  y con 5 hijos. Vive en el Recinto San Temistocles en el Cantón Ventanas.

La ventanilla NARCISA DE JESUS se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto San Temistocles, perteneciente al cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembre de maíz y arroz.
Luzmila  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz desde hace 2 años. Compra sus productos en Ventanas y las vende en el mercado del mismo lugar.

El crédito solicito para la compra de semillas y fertilizantes para la siembra del maíz y  arroz. El préstamo le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos para el consumo de la familia y para invertir. Su sueño es  tener una casa.
Le gusta descansar y pasear por el campo.
texts.en:
Luzmila is 53 years old.  She is married and lives with her husband and five children.  She lives in San Temistocles, in Ventanas canton.

The Narcisa de Jesus community bank is located in San Temistocles, in Ventanas canton.  The members of this bank work in short-cycle agriculture, growing corn and rice.

Luzmila is a farmer who has been growing corn for two years.  She buys her products in Ventanas and sells them in the market in the same place.

Luzmila will use the loan that she requested to buy seeds and fertilizers for growing corn and rice.  The loan will help her to increase her income which means she will be able to help her family and invest.  Her dream is to own her own home.

In her free time, Luzmila enjoys resting and walking in the countryside.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers for growing corn and rice

loans.name: Thou's Group

texts.en:
A mother of two dependent children who are both under school age, Thou is 29 years old and also a farmer in a village of the Cheung Prey district. She has been farming on her rice field as a primary business for six years. She also raises one cow and poultry (i.e. chicken and duck). She supplements her income by making hand-made chicken cages for sale. With her current business, she can earn less than $5 USD per day. 

Thou took her first loan from VisionFund in 2010, and she successfully paid back the loan with VisionFund. Now, she is able to have regular income and has some savings. Now applying for another loan with her group member who is just with VisionFund this loan cycle, Thou will use this entire loan to buy one more cow for plowing her farm. She hopes this loan will enable her to grow rice with full production capacity and earn more income so as to build on her savings to send her children to school.

loans.use: To buy one more cow for plowing her farm

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina used the previous loan amount of Php 50, 000 for buying stocks of frozen food products. Center for Community Transformation (CCT) quickly responded to her loan application and she wants to thank them for being considerate every time she requested for one. Genuine appreciation she wants to send to all of the people used by God for the approval and assistances on her previous loan, CCT and all of the lenders.

Cristina is now able to earn an approximate amount of Php 4, 000 every month. She aims that the business will continue to operate and have a business expansion so that she can sell her products to other locations. Since the business helped her sustain their daily needs aside from the income earned by her husband. To buy added products for her business like: chicken and pork and beef, hams, and sausages on a daily basis is what she aspires, that’s why she applied for a loan amount of Php 50, 000. If ever granted, the amount will make a vast effect on her business’ growth.

On a weekly basis, Cristina regularly meets with her co-fellowship members to share her life’s testimony, experience on the business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and listen to the Word of God. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 members. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social relationship with other partners, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy enough quantities of frozen meats like chicken and pork and beef, hams, and sausages.

loans.name: Maria Del Socorro

texts.en:
Miss Mary is originally from de Galeana, Nuevo leon, and she has been living in her current home for a year. It was then when she had a great need to have a better income so she started a small grocery store. Her husband is unemployed and her small children had many necessities. Thanks to her business they have been able to make it through with much effort and dedication. Things have not been easy and they had to face some difficult times.

Now Miss Mary requires a loan of $200 to expand her business by purchasing more merchandise and therefore increasing the number of her clients, providing them with a greater variety. You can help her and her family and you can be part of their growing business, their only source of income. Do not doubt it any longer. They will be grateful.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Mary es originaria de de Galeana Nuevo León y tiene radicando en su actual domicilio un año, es entonces cuando tuvo la necesidad de mejor sus ingresos poniendo una tiendita de abarrotes ya que su esposo no tiene empleo y tienen hijos pequeños que tienen muchas necesidades. Gracias a este negocio han podido salir adelante con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación. Las cosas no han sido fáciles y han tenido que enfrentar momentos complicados.

En estos momentos Doña Mary requiere de un préstamo de $200 DLLS para poder crecer, comprando más mercancía para incrementar su número de clientes al tener más variedad que ofrecer. Tú puedes apoyar a ella y su familia y ser parte del crecimiento de su negocio, que es la única fuente de subsistencia que tienen. No lo dudes más , ellos te lo vana agradecer.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Jennifer would like to start a beadwork business.

loans.name: Hursandoi

texts.en: Hursandoi is a mother of three children. Her children go to school. Her husband earns money but it is not enough to support their family. That is why she sells eggs. Hursandoi has over three years of experience in the sale of eggs. She works without days off. Her business is situated in the open-air market. She became a client of MicroInvest in January 2007.  She repays her loan on time. She has many plans about developing her business. She is going to agree to a contract with several canteens and candy stores for an ongoing partnership. To increase the number of products she sells, she will need a refrigerator, especially for the summer season. She will use the $500 loan to purchase a refrigerator.

loans.use: business development

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
Maria Elena is 30 years old, lives with her domestic partner and has three children (3, 7 and 11 years old). Her partner Oscar is a construction worker, but his salary is insufficient to cover the basic needs of the family. For this reason, Maria started her grocery store business four years ago. Previously, she used to sell clothes, but the profit was not good. Now with her store she is doing much better and, little by little, has managed to increase the variety of the products she offers, as well as the number of her clients. The love for her family and her wish that their children have access to a good education motivate her to try harder every day.

In order to continue growing and to improve the quality of the service she offers, she is requesting a $250 loan, that she’ll repay in four months, and which she plans to use for the purchase of merchandise to cover the needs of her clients. Maria trusts people that help the most needful and is very grateful for the opportunity she is being given to improve and to make her business grow.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria Elena tiene 30 años de edad, vive en unión libre y tiene tres hijos, de 3, 7 y 11 años de edad. Óscar, su pareja, trabaja en la construcción, pero su salario es insuficiente para cubrir las necesidades básicas de su familia. Por este motivo, Maria comenzó su negocio de abarrotes hace cuatro años. Anteriormente vendía ropa pero no recibía buenas ganancias. Ahora con su tienda le ha ido mucho mejor y poco a poco ha logrado incrementar la variedad de productos que ofrece en su negocio, así como sus clientes. El amor hacia su familia y el deseo de que sus hijos puedan tener acceso a una buena educación la motivan a esforzase más cada día.

Para continuar creciendo y mejorar la calidad del servicio que ofrece, ahora Maria está solicitando un préstamo de $250 dólares, que regresará en 4 meses, y que planea utilizar en la compra de mercancía para cubrir las necesidades de sus clientes. Maria confía en las personas que ayudan a quien más lo necesitan, ella agradece mucho la oportunidad que se le brinda de poder mejorar y hacer crecer su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Yem

texts.en: Mrs. Yem A., age 42, is a housewife in Phnom Penh. She would like to borrow $150 to finance the purchase of a motorbike so her husband (shown in the photo) can become a moto-taxi driver and earn $3 per day in revenue. They have eight children. One child is a garment worker who earns $80 per month,  three children are students, and four have gotten married and moved out of the house. With her husband's new job, the family will increase their income and be better able to pay for their children's education.

loans.use: Yem would like to purchase a motorbike for her husband to operate as a driver.

loans.name: Joy

texts.en: 'Clothes are what people cannot do without. I started selling clothes in the year 2004', said Miss Joy Edowe who is 27 years old and lives in Benin City, Nigeria. She is requesting for a loan of $475 to enable her to buy more clothes and jewellery for sale.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and jewellery

loans.name: Kossi Olivier

texts.fr:
At 40 years old, Mr. A. is married and the father of 5 children of all ages, but who have not had the opportunity to attend school because of the poverty that bears down upon the family's day to day situation. We know that Mr. A. was a motorcycle-taxi driver before he began to work definitively in the field of agriculture, growing bananas, which has been his only window of opportunity to rise from poverty. He benefited from a first loan and was able to repay this without difficulty. Today, he is applying for a new loan of $1,000 to expand his field and to purchase fertilizers. This will enable him to increase his production and to offer an education to his children during the next school year.

Translated from French by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Agé de 40 ans, Monsieur A. Kossi Olivier est marié et père de cinq (5) enfants tous âgés mais n’ont pas la chance d’être scolarisé à cause de la pauvreté qui sévit dans cette famille. Notons que Monsieur A. fut conducteur de taxi moto avant de se lancer définitivement dans la culture d’ananas dans sa localité, seule porte de sortir de sa misère. Il a bénéficié d’un premier crédit qui a été remboursé sans difficulté. A présent, il sollicite un nouveau crédit de $1000 pour agrandir son champ et acheter des fertilisants. Ceci lui permettra d’augmenter sa capacité de production et scolariser ses enfants à la rentrée prochaine.

loans.use: agrandissement de son champ et achat des fertilisants

loans.name: Luz María

texts.es:
Luz is the mother of small children. Her husband is a truck driver who is often on the road and away from home. When he's away, there are sometimes long gaps when he can't send money to cover the children's expenses. Consequently, Luz began helping a cousin sell cosmetics from a catalog with the goal of having an income to cover her family's daily expenses. Later, she decided to start her own business selling cosmetics and shoes bought from catalogs. Little by little, she's been able to build her business. She can now count on a list of customers who seek her out to buy her products.

Since her customers have placed various orders that Luz can't now provide, she's applying for a US$550 loan, to be repaid over 6 months, that she can use to buy new products to offer her customers. With your help, Luz will be able to push her family ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Luz María es madre de unos pequeños. Su esposo es conductor de trailers. Y constantemente se la pasa fuera de la ciudad. Y al andar fuera, en ocaciones tarda mucho en mandarle dinero para los gastosde sus hijos. Es por eso que Luz con el propósito de tener un ingreso que le ayude a cubrir los gastos diarios de sus hijos, comenzó a ayudarle a una prima a vender cosméticos por catálogo, y las ganancias se las dividían. Después de un tiempo se decidió iniciar su propio negocio de venta de cosméticos por catálogo y a este negocio le agregó la venta de zapatos por catálogo. Poco a poco Luz a podido crecer su negocio. Actualmente ya cuenta con una cartera de clientes que la buscan para comprarle sus productos.

Sin embargo sus clientes le hicieron varios pedidos que Luz no a podido surtir, es por eso que está solicitando un crédito de US $550 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero Luz podrá comprar productos nuevos para poder tener ofertas nuevas para sus clientes. Con tu ayuda Luz podrá sacar adelante a su familia.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase potatoes, baking flour, sugar, eggs, cooking oil, a frying pan, and raw materials to construct a stand

loans.name: Oscar Leonel

texts.es:
Mr. Oscar C. O. sells replacement parts and accessories for motorcycles at a store in the municipality of Condega of the city of Estelí. At a young age he showed interest on motorcycles and for that reason, three years ago Mr. C. O. began his business selling few parts. As time has passed, he has been able to sell larger quantities of replacement parts in the municipal region where he lives, which has improved his economic situation.

Ceprodel has been a key player on the development of his business since it has given Mr. C. O. three loans, that he used to acquire motorcycle replacement parts. Nowadays, one of his greater needs is the urgency to purchase more replacement parts in order to sell them. It is for that reason that he expects Ceprodel to provide him with another loan so he can continue to develop his business and thus, support his family .

Translated from Spanish by Antonella Sacconi, Kiva Volunteer.

La actividad económica del caballero Oscar C. O. es la venta de repuestos y accesorios para motocicletas teniendo su establecimiento en el municipio de Condega de la ciudad de Estelí. Desde muy joven ha tenido inclinación hacia las motocicletas y por este motivo comienza su negocio con pocos repuestos desde hace tres años pero a medida que ha venido transcurriendo el tiempo ha mejorado su situación vendiendo mayores cantidades de repuestos en su localidad.

Ceprodel ha sido uno de los ejes fundamentales para el desarrollo del negocio por el motivo de que le ha proporcionado créditos (3 créditos) que han sido utilizados por el señor Oscar en la adquisición de los repuestos para la motocicleta. Hoy en día una de sus mayores necesidades es la urgencia de la compra de los repuestos para comercializarlos. Es por este motivo que espera que Ceprodel le otorgue el crédito para continuar con su negocio y así sostener su núcleo familiar.

loans.use: To Purchase Replacement Parts

loans.name: Biakamangue

texts.fr:
Mrs. Biakamangue K., 33, is married and the mother of three children. In 1999 she opened up a little store she calls ETS DIEU N’OUBLIE PERSONNE where she sells everyday necessities in the neighborhood of Agoè. Her first loan in the amount of US$ 1100 allowed her to purchase the goods she retails in sufficient quantity to avoid going back and forth a lot to the Central Market in Lomé. She was also able to avoid buying on credit which used to cut into her profit.

Since her turnover has now increased and in view of the needs of her clientele, she would like to request another loan of US$ 1100 to purchase 10 sacks of rice, 10 tins of vegetable oil, and seven sacks of sugar.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Agée de 33 ans, Madame K. Biakamangue est mariée et mère de trois (3) enfants. En 1999 elle a crée une boutique « ETS DIEU N’OUBLIE PERSONNE » de vente des produits de première nécessité dans le quartier d’Agoè. Son premier crédit d’un montant de 450.000FCFA lui a permis de s’approvisionner en quantité suffisante pour éviter de faire d’incessants allers-retours vers le Grand Marché de Lomé et de se soustraire du crédit fournisseur qui ne lui permet pas de gagner suffisamment.

Suite à l’accroissement de la vente et aux besoins de la clientèle, elle désire reconduire son crédit pour un montant de 450.000 FCA pour acheter dix (10) sacs de riz, dix (10) bidons d’huile végétale et sept (7) sacs de sucre.

loans.use:
Purchase of 10 bags of rice and 10 tins of vegetable oil

Achat de 10 sacs de riz et de 10 bidons d'huile végétale

loans.name: Awo

texts.fr:
Madame Awo A. is married and the mother of one. She is 33 years old. A seamstress, she also specializes in preparing red oil "l'huile rouge"." Awo hopes to apply for this first loan with FECECAV to help increase her commercial activity by enabling her to purchase more traditional style skirts and palm nuts(to make the oil). The profits she sees will help her to support her family as she is currently the sole provider while her husband is unemployed.

Translated from French to English by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Madame Awo A. est mariée, mère de 1 enfant et âgée de 33 ans. Couturière, elle est aussi spécialiste de la préparation de l’huile rouge à partir de la noix de palme. Awo souhaite par ce crédit qui est le premier de FECECAV, augmenter les capacités de son activité en achetant 5 balles de pagnes et des noix de palmes. Les profits qui se dégageront de son activité lui permettront de supporter les besoins de son enfant étant donné que son mari n’a pas d’emploi.

loans.use: To increase her commercial activity by purchasing traditional style skirts and palm nuts

loans.name: Ramatu's Group

texts.en: Ramatu S. is fifty-one years old and married with 9 children.  She lives with 6 of her children who are still young.  Ramatu sells firewood to earn income to provide the children with their needs, including school supplies.  Ramatu's husband is a retired teacher and her business is the main source of income for the family.  Fatamata owns a small kiosk in her homestead. Ramatu and Fatamata would like to expand their businesses and are therefore requesting a loan of Le.1,600,000.

loans.use: Purchase stock of fire wood

loans.name: Sowa's Group

texts.en: Moses Kamara, Thomas Kamara, Sorie Tholley and Mohamed Keita are requesting a loan of  Le 3,800,000.00. They are all military personnel who engage in outside business because military salaries are not adequate. The loan will be divided among their wives who will invest in various businesses while the men work in the military. This will help them all improve their incomes and support their families.

loans.use: To buy more local produce--rice,palm-oil,onions etc.

loans.name: Herminia Del Socorro

texts.es:
Herminia del Socorro U. is a very hard-working lady whose work is selling of office supplies in her locality of the municipality of El Viejo in the city of Chinandega in the beautiful nation of Nicaragua.

Since she started the business, she has managed to supply the needs of her home of habitation and has maintained her small son of school age. Her larger dreams are that her small child should become a great professional and for this she works hard in her business.

For these reasons Señora Herminia seeks the support of Ceprodel to obtain the loan necessary for the purchase of her merchandise and in this way to continue with the maintenance of her home and of her small son.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Herminia del Socorro U. es una dama muy esforzada cuya labor es la venta de productos de librería comercializados en su localidad en el municipio de El Viejo de la ciudad de Chinandega de la bella nacion de Nicaragua.

Desde que inició el negocio ha logrado suplir las necesidades de su hogar de habitacion y ha mantenido a su pequeño hijo en edad escolar.Sus mayores sueños son que su pequeño llegue a ser un gran profesional y para ello se esfuerza grandemente en su negocio.

Por estas razones es que la señora Herminia busca el apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener el credito necesario para la compra de su mercaderia y asi continuar con el mantenimiento de su hogar y de su pequeño hijo.

loans.use: To buy office supplies for resale.

loans.name: Yasmeen's Group

texts.en:
Yasmeen baji, the wife of G. N., has been living in an area of Lahore, Pakistan called Ismail Nagar for the last 17 years. She is the mother of four children: two sons and two daughters. Her eldest son works in 'PEL' (a famous electronics company) while her other son is in 7th standard. Her daughters are in 10th standard. Yasmeen baji's husband has been a driver by profession for the last five years, while she has operated a business selling clothes for the last 10 years. Yasmeen baji fully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institution of Pakistan) and is now requesting a loan to buy more clothes to resell.

She is joined in her loan group by five other members. Sabra baji and Shahnaz baji each want a loan to buy clothes to resell; Sugran baji and Rani baji each want to buy material (woods and wood polisher) for their furniture making business, while Kubra baji wants a loan to buy more clothes to resell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to resell

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Afi N. est âgée de 38 ans, mariée et mère de 2 enfants tous sur les bancs de l’école. Elle réside depuis son enfance à Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Afi exerce le commerce des boissons depuis bientôt 5 ans et cette activité est sa principale source de revenus. Elle espère avec premier crédit de FECECAV accroître la capacité de son activité en achetant beaucoup plus de marchandises.
texts.en:
Afi N. is 38 years old, married and the mother of two school-aged children. Since childhood she has lived in Lomé, the capital of Togo. For the past five years Afi has traded in beverages and this business is her principal source of revenue. With her first loan from FECECAV, she hopes to expand her business by purchasing more merchandise.

Translated from French by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of beverages and other products for retail sale

loans.name: Maria De La Paz

texts.es:
Doña Maria es madre soltera y tiene un solo hijo. Actualmente tiene 60 años de edad, es profesora cesante y vive en el Jr. Yunguyo s/n, distrito de Juli, provincia de Chucuito, departamento de Puno.

Es una de las socias fundadoras del Banco Comunal “Niño San Salvador” de Juli. Con el primer préstamo de S/. 300 aumentó su capital y compró lana para tejer chompas. Desde los 28 años de edad empezó a trabajar tejiendo en Artesanías de Puno. Luchó por sacar adelante a su hijo y este negocio la ayudo a poder apoyar económicamente a su hijo que en ese momento estaba estudiando. En la actualidad teje chompas en palillo y los vende según el pedido que le hacen.

Con este préstamo de S/. 400, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará 3 Kg. de lana para tejer a S/.114 y otros materiales que necesita para dar el acabado a las prendas que teje.

Su deseo es sacar al mercado sus prendas y así obtener más ganancias.
texts.en:
Doña Maria is a single mother and has just one son. Currently she is 60 years old, she is an unemployed teacher and lives at Jr. Yunguyo (no house number), Juli district, Chucuito province, in the department of Puno. She is one of the founding members of the “Niño San Salvador” Communal Bank of Juli. With the first loan of S/. 300 she increased her capital and bought wool to knit sweaters. When she was 28 years of age she started to work weaving in Puno Crafts. She struggled to provide opportunities for her son and this business helped her to be able to economically support her son when he was studying. She currently weaves sweaters and sells them according to the orders that are placed. With this loan of S/. 400, which will be repaid in 4 installments, she will buy 3 Kg. of wool to weave at S/.114 and others materials that she needs to finish the items that she weaves. Her wish is to bring her items to market and through this obtain more earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy 3 kg. of wool at S/.114.

loans.name: Hugo

texts.es: Hugo tiene 30 años, es casado, vive con su esposa y dos hijos. Es agricultor,  se dedica a esta actividad por más de 15 años, siendo esta la labor que la agrada realizar, sobre todo porque es una actividad independiente, administrar su producción y trabajar sus tierras le hace sentir  bien.  Cultiva frutos cítricos, se inclinó por estos productos al notar que son muy demandados, además que siempre quiso dedicarse a cultivar  frutas que le agradaran, además las lleva a las ciudades de la sierra para venderlas, donde pagan precios adecuados que recompensan su inversión, lo  difícil es  trasladarlas a estas ciudades, ya que sino se cuenta con un camión, resulta caro el traslado de los productos. Es su segundo préstamo con MFP, no tuvo problemas hasta el momento en  sus pagos. Hugo invertirá  el dinero solicitado en la compra de nuevas plantas de cítricos  y de abonos.
texts.en:
Hugo is 30 years old, married, and lives with his wife and two children. He is a farmer that has been enjoyably doing his job for more than 15 years. More than anything, his job is independent: he oversees the production and works the land which makes him feel good. He grows citrus fruits, which he was inclined to grow even though they require much work because he had always wanted to grow a fruit he liked. He brings them to the mountains to sell where the people pay more to compensate for the travel investment. The difficulty is making this extra trouble worthwhile; even with using his van, the products become expensive. This is his second loan with MFP. He has not yet had any problems with his payments. Hugo will invest the money into the purchase of new citrus plants and fertilizer.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase new citrus plants and fertilizer

loans.name: Chhon

texts.en:
Mr. Chhon T. lives in Da Rap Doluos village in Kandal province. He is a fisherman. His wife, Mrs. Suo Sen, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land where she cultivates rice.

On the plantation, she faces a problem because her field is infertile. Additionally, Mr. Chhon T. does not have enough fishnets for fishing. To deal these problems, he is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer to support the field. This will make his crop more productive. He will use the rest of the money to buy more fishnets for his fishing business.

Mr. Chhon T. has eight children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory, and the other six are enrolled in the local school. The youngest one is too young to work or study. His wife is presented on the photo near him.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and fishnets.

loans.name: Elaine

texts.en:
Mrs. Elaine P., 41 years of age, is happily married with 4 children. They live comfortably at Barra Puntod, Lopez Jaena. Fishing and fish vending are their means of survival. Raising their children has been quite a challenge, with their day-to-day experiences at sea and retailing in the neighborhood. The ups and downs of their business, health and education of their children are a continuing everyday undertaking.

According to Elaine, fishing is the life of her family and she will maintain it until she grows old. Her humble aspiration is simply to have a daily income to support their needs and basic necessities. She also would like to own 3 pumpboats and additional capital for fishing. In this way, she would be able to uplift their way of living.

loans.use: To aquire a fishing boat

loans.name: Jamily

texts.ru:
Джамиля предприниматель с 5–и летним стажем. Ей 24 года. Она занимается торговлей детской одежды на рынке "Станция" города Вахдат. С связи с тяжелым финансовым положением родителей, решила начать свой бизнес. На сбережения отца арендовала маленькое место на рынке и стала заниматься продажей детской одежды. Получаемый доход стал основным источником в ее семейном бюджете. Закупает она товар в оптовом рынке «Корвон» и с поставщиков с Китая. Так как сейчас сезон зимних одежд ее ассортимент товара составляет разные детские юбочки, брюки, пуловер и т.д. 
Джамиле хочет получить займ в сумме 1500 сомони  сроком на 6 месяцев.
texts.en:
Jamily K., 24, has been in business for 5 years. She started the business to relief her family's hard financial situation. Now, Jamily's business is the main source of income for her family. Jamily sells clothing for children at "Station" market in Vakhdat. Now Jamily sells winter clothing. She needs this loan to purchase additional inventory of goods. Jamily will repay this loan within 6 months.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase clothing for children inventory

loans.name: Rubina Aman Ullah Group
loans.use: To buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Daler

texts.ru: Хушмахмадов Далер проживает в районе Файзабад. Возраст 23 года , женат и имеет двоих детей. Имеет средне-техническое образование,но по специальности не работает. Занимается животноводством. Планирует получить кредит и купить дойную , породистую корову. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 15 месяцев.
texts.en:
Daler H. lives in the Fayazad district. He is 23 years old, married and has two children. He has a secondary-technical education, but does not work in his field. He is involved in animal husbandry. Daler plans to obtain the loan to buy a purebred dairy cow.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase livestock headcount

loans.name: Lucaya

texts.en:
Lucaya A. is a 41-year-old mother of five children. The oldest is 22 years and the youngest is 8 years old. She tries to send all her eligible children to school everyday, but Lucaya cannot afford to send any to college. She also says that sometimes she cannot afford to send her children to class and on those days, the children stay home and work. She is married and her husband is what they call a “casual worker” here in Kenya – similar to a “day-laborer.”

Lucaya lives in Kasawino near the Nymasaria slum, where she sells vegetables. She buys the bulk of her stock from Kibuye market in downtown Kisumu. She likes running her own business because she does not have to rely on anyone for her daily bread. She also likes not having a boss. She is asking for 10,000 KSH to help with school fees and to purchase more stock.

Lucaya recently joined the K-MET volunteer Community Health Worker (CHW) group in Kisumu, Kenya. As a CHW she will be trained by K-MET and will begin visiting members of her community who are sick with a variety of illness. Her work will include distributing Nutriflour (a vitamin enriched flour produced by K-MET) to malnourished patients, providing reproductive health education, referring patients to local clinics and hospitals, and providing basic health care.

loans.use: To help with school fees and to purchase more vegetables for her business

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella is 60 years old, married and has been blessed with six children who are all married and live separately from them. Her husband, Pedro, is already 64 years old and works as a local farmer in their village. Farming is the major source of their income.

Estrella is engaged in selling clothes, which adds to their income. She roams house to house in their village and in nearby villages to sell different clothes for men and women. Often, she goes to the distant place of Baggao, Cagayan where she is able to sell the most. From their business, Estrella is able to earn around PHP 2,000 (~$40) daily. She is thankful that she is able to maintain her business and through this, she is able to support the education of her grandchildren, who live with them. Estrella is active in developing her business and she is requesting to borrow a loan amounting to PHP 17,000 ($375 US). The loan will serve as additional capital to expand her business. She believes that by entrusting everything to God is the best step to succeed in every life’s endeavor.

loans.use: To provide additional capital for clothing sales

loans.name: Sakina Karamat Ali Group

texts.en:
Sakina baji is the wife of K. A. who has resided in Kasur, Pakistan for the last 10 years. Kasur city is famous for its sweetmeat and its shrines. Sakina baji is a very hardworking lady. She operates a kite-making business. In Pakistan, kids and elders are fond of kite flying; some kids take this activity as a hobby. She earns a good income from this business and saves it in a committee for a rainy day. Her husband runs a grocery shop in the community. He has three years of experience in this business. Sakina baji is applying for a loan to buy groceries for her husband’s grocery shop. 

She is the group leader of seven other women from her locality. Mussarat baji and Farzana baji each want a loan for their kite-making business. Firdous baji, another Firdous baji, Shazia baji, Tariza baji and Suraiya baji each want a loan for their leather-selling business. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy groceries for grocery shop

loans.name: Rofya Group

texts.en: Rofya is the group leader of the Rofya group, which includes three other members. The borrowers are happy that with the loan they can improve their business. Both Rofya and Pary Naz want a loan to expand their general store. Hamida wants a loan to buy stick for her bakery business. Balqes wants a loan to buy one or two sewing machines for her tailoring business. With this loan, the women would be able to not only improve their business but also financially support themselves and their family.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Ismoil

texts.en:
E. Ismoil has been running a business manufacturing  wooden doors and window frames. He inherited this business from his father. Now, Ismoil wishes to improve his working conditions to be able to provide services of the best quality in the neighborhood. 

Ismoil is 38 years old, married with seven children. Now in his eighth year of operation, Ismoil is applying for a loan for the eighth time. He has gained a reputation for responsibility in his financial obligations and for keeping his word. Ismoil requests 3400 Somoni. He would like to thank everyone supporting him and promises to repay the loan in a timely fashion. We are happy to have another opportunity to assist Ismoil with the operation of his business.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:
Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its epic mountain passes and its rich history which includes its place as a key post along the Silk Road and events at the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has produced famous thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. A civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged an already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural productivity and the manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent viable business prospects. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase materials

loans.name: Mamud

texts.en:
G. Mamud is a hard-working man who is in agriculture. He has worked at this business for a long time and acquired his abilities in ranching and farming when he was very young. He is a married father with responsibilities for maintaining his 3 children. Mamud is known as being very responsible and hard-working, because every day, very early in the morning, he starts his job taking care of his fields and raising cattle in his own pen located at his house. IMON International has been the backbone of his business because they gave him loans which have allowed him to improve his standard of living through the acquisition of cattle and vegetables for planting. Today, once again, Mamud trusts that his credit will be approved and he will be able to improve his business with the purchase of cattle and farm supplies to plant.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizer and cattle in order to expand the business

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria U. is 32 years old and married with 4 children. She has a salon where she produces lovely hairstyles for her customers. She is requesting a loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more hair extensions to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more hair extensions to sell

loans.name: Cornelia

texts.en: At her age of 43, Cornelia G. patiently maintains her vegetable vending business in their Barangay. She is married to Santiago, a good and loving husband. They are gifted with two children: Jaycer and Jay - Mark. The couple lives peacefully in the rural village of Banquero, Reina Mercedes, Isabela. Her husband helps her in maintaining their vegetable production that she retails in their village and sometimes in the market. She even sells volumes of harvested vegetables to buyers in wholesale price. Cornelia wants to have continuous business to be able to support most of their family’s necessities, that’s why Cornelia is requesting a loan from Kiva lenders amounting to PHP5, 000 as business additional capital. Moreover, her dream in life is to maintain the good health of her family to be able to comply with their responsibilities and obligations in life.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Maruja

texts.es:
Maruja es socia del Banco Comunal Señor de los Milagros.
Maruja es conviviente, tiene 31 años y 2 hijos, Maruja tiene una panadería en su casa en donde elabora panes típicos, sus ventas los realiza en el mercado Santa Clara, actividad que realiza todos los días por las tardes.
Maruja necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de harina y azúcar.
Maruja sueña con construir el segundo piso de su casa y comprar maquinas para su panadería.
texts.en:
Maruja is a member of the Señor de los Milagros Community Bank. Maruja is 31 years old with a live-in partner and two children. She has a bakery in her house in which she bakes traditional breads. She carries out her sales in the Santa Clara market, an activity she engages in every day in the afternoon.

Maruja needs a loan of 1000 soles, money that will be invested in the purchase of flour and sugar. Maruja dreams of building a second floor for her house and buying machines for her bakery

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of flour and sugar

loans.name: Maya

texts.en: Maya is a married woman living with her husband in her family house. She has been working as a hairdresser on her own since 2001 and has 12 years of experience in this field. Today, Maya is requesting to borrow $1,200 to purchase additionA. beauty products to satisfy the demand of her clientele.

loans.use: To purchase additional beauty products

loans.name: Aquilino

texts.es:
Aquilino tiene 69 años, vive con su esposa en su casa propia. Hace 30 años se dedica a la agricultura, siembra papa y maíz principalmente. Como jefe de hogar ha sido el responsable de proveer para su familia a través de la agricultura y de su oficio como sastre. Ahora que sus hijos ya están grandes, ayudan a  Aquilino en todo el proceso agrícola, desde la siembra, hasta la comercialización de los productos en el mercado de su localidad. El deseo de Aquilino es seguir trabajando en la agricultura hasta donde le sigan dando sus fuerzas. 
Esta es la oportunidad número 13 que tiene un crédito con MFP, él es un integrante muy activo de su banco comunal y siempre está presto a colaborar en lo que necesita su grupo. Además, en todo este tiempo también ha demostrado ser muy puntual en sus pagos. El dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá en la compra de sacos de abono para su próxima siembra.

loans.use: Compra de abono

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy E. is from the town of Sepac, Sapang Dalaga,  Misamis Occidental. She is 42 years old. Mercy is married and has one child. To make a living, Mercy owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting & harvesting corn for sale. Mercy is just starting her farming business.

In 2005, Mercy joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mercy has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,900 PHP from PMPC. Mercy is requesting a new loan of 14900 PHP which will be used to purchase the land where she raises crops. This loan will be the 6th loan taken out by Mercy from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.
