Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase the land where she raises crops

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria E. operates a provisions store at Elmina near Ankwanda.  Victoria has received junior high education.  She is single and has four children. Victoria has been selling provisions such as Milo (cocoa drink powder), sugar,  toothbrushes, and so on since 2007.  Her loan will be used to buy more provisions to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to build a house.

loans.use: buy more provisions to sell

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina F. is from the village of Mialen, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 45 years old. Gina is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Gina owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. Gina has been engaged in her business for over 21 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Gina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future. Gina is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Gina from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay tuition fees for her children.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is forty-five years old. She is married and has three children, all in school. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in Axim. Axim is along the coastal area in the western region of Ghana. Fishing business is the main occupation for the majority of people. Elizabeth is a trader; she trades in plantains. Elizabeth buys the goods from the nearby farming communities and treks to sell them.  She also sells to food vendors in her community. Elizabeth has been in business for two years and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy plantains to sell.

loans.name: Phoebe

texts.en: Phoebe C. is from the village of Sta. Cruz, Plaridel. She is 60 years old, is married, and has three adult children. Phoebe's main source of income comes from her pension of approximately 8,000 PHP a month. On March 31st, 2007, Phoebe joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Phoebe is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP which will be used to purchase housing materials for the repair of her house. This loan will be her 8th from PMPC. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase housing materials for her house renovation

loans.name: Milojane

texts.en:
Our featured entrepreneur in this story is the operator of a motorcycle transport known locally as “Jabal-jabal”. She is Mrs. Milojane E., 40 years of age, married and a resident of Bolinsong, Bonifacio, Mis. Occ. She is married to Magellan E., a motorcycle driver himself. Having four children was not easy for them but still they were able to raise an average income of P3,000 from their own motorcycle business. She joined PAGLAUM MPC in 2009 because she was interested in the many products PMPC had to offer. As a newly recognized member, she borrowed P5,000 to repair and recondition her single motorcycle for hire. She is hoping that someday they can buy another motorcycle and to be able to send her four children to college.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: Repair and reconditioning of her motorcycle for hire

loans.name: Adama

texts.fr:
Né le 16 Juin 1976 à Sikasso, Monsieur  Adama Berthé est marié et réside avec son épouse et leurs trois enfanfs à Banconi, un des quartiers péripheriques de la ville de Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Monsieur Berthé, après avoir mener plusieurs activités sans succès,  s’est initié aux activités de commerce notamment à l’achat et la vente des volailles il y a environ huit  ans. Il dispose d’une une place au niveau du marché à volailles de Wayerma I. Il est beaucoup sollicité de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses volailles. 
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, il décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec qui il est à son premier prêt individuel.
 Avec ce premier prêt, il compte acheter, 30 poulets, 20 pintades, 10 paires de dindons, 5 paires de canards, 4 paires de oies. 
Il achete ses volailles dans les villages environnants de la ville de Sikasso et effectue sa vente en détail au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle diverse et variée.
 Avec ce prêt il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 100 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement  pour contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Born on June 16, 1976 in Sikasso, Mr. Adama Berthé is married and resides with his wife and their three children in Banconi, one of the suburbs of the city of Sikasso (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). After having worked in several jobs unsuccessfully, he got introduced about eight years ago to commercial work, especially in the buying and selling of poultry. He has a spot at the poultry market of Wayerma I and is in high demand by his customers for the quality of his poultry. To satisfy his burgeoning customer base, he decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso and is now on his first individual loan. With this first loan, he intends to buy: 20 chickens, 20 Guinea hens, 10 pairs of turkeys, 5 pairs of ducks, and 4 geese. He buys his poultry from the villages surrounding Sikasso city, and he sells at the retail level, accepting cash or credit from a diverse and varied customer base. With this loan, he envisions realizing a monthly profit of 100,000 francs CFA that will essentially be used to cover the loan interest and to invest the rest into his business.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying poultry

loans.name: Elmira

texts.en: Elmira P. makes a living by selling seafood products including crabs in her community of Taguitic, Lanao Del Norte. She is 34 years old, married and has four school-age children. Elmira has been in her business for over five years and earns approximately 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2008, Elmira joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Elmira has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC which was used to to purchase products to sell. Elmira is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be her fourth loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Ricarda

texts.es:
La señora Ricarda inicia su dia de trabajo abriendo su tramo desde las 8:00 Am ofertando los diferentes tipos de artisanias confeccionados en madera y palmas, su negocio esta ubicado en el mercado central.
 
Este crédito que solicito es  para la compra de perchas de madera, roperos, mesas, sombreros de palma, petates, cómodas de madera y otras variedades.

Cabe mencionar que la señora Ricarda gracias a los   créditos con Ceprodel le ha permitido hacer sus compras de contado lo que le genera mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Ricarda starts her work day at 8am. She sells all kinds of crafts made from wood and palm fronds; her business is located in the central market. She is asking for funding to buy wood coat racks, armoires, tables, palm hats, palm frond mats, wood chests, etc. It is worth mentioning that Ricarda, thanks to Ceprodel loans, has been able to buy paying cash which generates better profits for her.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wood, coat stands, closets, chests, hats, wood wisks, small tables, palm frond mats, etc.

loans.name: Marcelina Lilliam

texts.es:
La Señora Marcelina Lilliam B. C., es trabajadora de la Alcaldía de Chinandega  se desempeña como Secretaria, Habita en la comarca  San Benito, es Acompañada tiene 3 hijos , pero solo uno depende de ella , los otros dos ya trabajan por su cuenta.

La Señora Marcelina Lilliam B. C., solicito crédito  para reparar su vivienda ya necesitaba sacar su cocina a una parte del patio para tener más espacio dentro de su casa.
texts.en:
Marcelina works as a secretary for the Chinandega municipality and lives in the San Betino neighborhood. She has three children, but only one still depends on her. The others work and support themselves. Marcelina requested this loan in order to make modifications to her home. She needed to move her kitchen to an outdoor part of her patio in order to have more room within.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Building materials

loans.name: Carlos Antonio

texts.es:
Carlos Antonio vive en la ciudad de Urubamba y tiene un pequeño negocio familiar de venta de material de construcción. El socio tiene 24 años es un joven responsable que busca a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario ayudar a su familia. 

Carlos Antonio pertenece al banco comunal “TERCER MILENIO” de la Asociación Arariwa. Ya es un año que participa en el banco comunal. Su primer crédito del socio fue de 100 dólares de las cuales invirtió en su negocio. Actualmente, el socio requiere el préstamo para comprar una mezcladora. El anhelo del socio es abrir su propia  negocio de fabricación de ladrillos y bloquetas de cemento. 

El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Carlos Antonio lives in the city of Urubamba and has a small family business selling construction materials. He is 24 years of age and a responsible young man who looks at each moment as an opportunity to succeed and strive each day to help his family.

Carlos Antonio is a member of the Communal Bank “Tercer Milenio” (Third Millennium), which is part of Asociación Arariwa. It has already been a year that he has participated in the Communal Bank. His first loan as a member was for $100, which he used to invest in his business. He currently needs a loan to buy a cement mixer. His wish is to open his own business manufacturing bricks and cement blocks.

Carlos Antonio is grateful for this opportunity and commits to making his payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a cement mixer

loans.name: Tiwaa Group

texts.en:
Mercy is forty-one years old. She is a married woman and has given birth to three children who are between the ages of six and seventeen. Mercy lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in their community. Her husband is a petty trader. He trades in general goods in a shop in the community. 

Mercy is a hard-working and a trustworthy woman, a seamstress by profession. She has been sewing for fifteen years and has trained a number of apprentices who are also currently manning their own shops. Mercy buys her raw materials such as textiles and other sewing accessories, including needles, linings, thread, etc. from nearby towns. She hopes to put up her own building structure to house her family.

Mercy is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Yesu Nti’, which literally means ‘because of Jesus’. The group is made up of five members. Some are traders and others are into hairdressing. They request the loan to procure goods and raw materials in bulk to expand their businesses.

loans.use: To buy textiles and sewing accessories

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchasing sodas and other soft drinks for resale

loans.name: Eddie

texts.en:
Eddie J., S.., is from the village of Nungnungan, Cauayan City, Isabela. He is 38 years old. Eddie is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Eddie raises crops. Primarily, he plants and harvests rice for sale. Eddie has been engaged in his business for over 17 years and earns approximately 40,000 PHP per harvest.

In 2006, Eddie joined ASKI to gain access to financial services. He hoped to help improve his living situation and increase his ability to engage in business activities. Eddie is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Eddie from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of his children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise

loans.name: Raquel Armanda

texts.es:
RAQUEL P., TIENE 46 AÑOS ES SEPARADA VIVE CON SUS DOS HIJOS TODAVIA SOLTEROS Y ESTUDIANTES. VIVE EN CASA PROPIA.
ELLA TIENE UNA AMPLIA EXPERIENCIA DE SU NEGOCIO COMO COMERCIANTE DE TODO TIPO DE VERDURAS, SU NEGOCIO ESTA UBICADO EN EL MERCADO MUNICIPAL DE SANTIAGO SACATEPEQUEZ, DESDE HACE 15 AÑOS. RAQUEL ATIENDE SU PUESTO Y CON SU  CALIDO TRATO A SUS CLIENTES LOGRA QUE LOS MISMOS LA VISITEN DE NUEVO TAMBIEN POR SU AMPLIO SURTIDO DE VERDURAS FRESCAS. ES POR ESO QUE HA TENIDO ÉXITO Y HA LOGRADO AGRANDAR SU PUESTO. GRACIAS AL CREDITO ANTERIOR LOGRO MONTAR OTRO NEGOCIO DE PRODUCTOS MEDICINALES NATURAL  Y DESEA OTRO CREDITO PARA SURTIR SU NEGOCIO CON OTROS PRODUCTOS QUE SUS CLIENTES LE PIDEN, ELLA HA TRABAJADO DURO POR SALIR ADELANTE  Y TIENE VARIAS METAS COMO POR EJEMPLO  SEGUIR AYUDANDO A SUS HIJOS CON SUS  ESTUDIOS
texts.en:
Raquel P., 46, is separated and lives with her two, still-single, student sons in her own home. She has ample experience as a vegetable merchant. Her stand has been located in Santiago Sacatepequez’s municipal market for 15 years. Raquel tends to it herself and, thanks to her warm customer service and wide selection of fresh vegetables, she insures that her customers return regularly. Thanks to the previous loan she was able to set up an additional business consisting of natural products sales. She is asking for a new loan to stock other products her customers are asking for. She works hard to get ahead and has several goals one of which is to help her sons with their schooling.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To better stock her business.

loans.name: Julia Alicia

texts.es:
Alicia es viuda y tiene una hija que estudia en el instituto y su mayor sueño es que su hija sea una gran profesional, Alicia vive en la comunidad de Pacaycasa que se encuentra a 30 minutos de la ciudad de Ayacucho, en donde tiene terrenos con tara y tuna que cosecha y también acopia de otros productores para luego comercializarlo a los intermediarios. Además Alicia se dedica a la crianza de cuy en su casa y siembra alfalfa para la alimentación de los mismos.
Alicia es socia del Banco Comunal Bienestar y solicita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cuy para engorde y tara.
texts.en:
Alicia is a widow and has a daughter who studies at the Institute. Her greatest dream is that her daughter will be a successful professional. Alicia lives in the community of Pacaycasa, which is located 30 minutes from the city of Ayacucho, where she has land with tara plant and prickly pear which she harvests and then combines with the produce of other farmers to sell to a middleman. Alicia also works raising guinea pigs in her house and grows alfalfa to feed them. Alicia is a member of the community bank "Bienestar" and requests a loan of $550 that she will use to buy guinea pigs to fatten and the plant tara.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy guinea pigs to fatten and tara.

loans.name: Gulbahor

texts.en:
F. Gulbahor is a hard-working woman who is married and has four children. For the past three years, she has made a living selling office supplies and children's clothing. She started her business after her husband lost his job at a construction company and bills started to pile up. She likes her work, has developed a stable business, and is applying for a loan for $3,000 to buy new items to sell. Success is important to her family's well-being, which is why she hopes that Kiva lenders will be able to support her. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International
Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. A civil war, which ignited soon after independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy office supplies and clothing to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en: Flora M. is from the village of Burgos, Naguillan. She is 46 years old and is married with four school-aged children. Flora owns and operates a business raising pigs for fattening and sale. She has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Flora joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to to purchase piglets to raise and sell. Flora is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase pig feed and other supplies. This loan will be her second from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small-business entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase pig feed and other supplies

loans.name: Adrienne

texts.fr:
Femme de 48ans, célibataire et mère de 2 enfants dont l’âge varie entre 23ans et 18ans .Elle a commencée en 1978  à vendre  les patates douces grillées devant la parcelle de ses parents avec 2500f de fond.
Avec la réalité du pays, elle s’est lancé dans le commerce des habits en 2002 et ouvre une boutique avec étalage  à la devanture.
Par jour elle a des recettes de 7500f minimun et 20000f maximum, ses bénéfices sont considérables, ce prêt va lui permettre d’acheter dans les magasins de la place des  lots de  tee-shirts, des pantalons jeans pour enfants, 5 douzaines des  chemises mixtes, 3 douzaines  des robes pour fillettes, 3 douzaines de culottes pour petits garçons,10 d’ensembles sous vetements  pour dames.
Elle à pour vision de  faire plus de bénéfices et commencer dans la vente en gros,  elle est seule à subvenir aux  besoins des ses filles, car elle les soutien dans leurs études.
texts.en:
This 48-year old woman is single and the mother of two children, 23 and 18 years old. She got her start in business back in 1978, selling baked yams in front of her parents’ land plot, with a starting capital of 2500 francs. With the changing economic reality in the country, in 2002, she started selling clothing and opened a store with a stall in front. Her daily sales volume ranges between 7,500 and 20,000 West African francs. This is a considerable income. Her loan will allow her to purchase from local stores a supply of T-shirts, children’s jeans, five dozens of various types of shirts, three dozens of girls’ dresses, three dozens of pants for young boys, 10 sets of women’s lingerie. Her vision is to increase her revenues and to start selling wholesale. She alone provides for her daughters and supports their studies.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing T-shirts,pants, and shirts for children, as well as underwear

loans.name: María Cecilia

texts.es:
En la hermosa ciudad de Portoviejo capital manabita rodeada por maravillosas playas y de clima cálido y agradable, encontramos el Banco Comunal Pequeños Comerciantes.

Aquí conversamos con la señora María que nos cuenta algo de su vida. Tiene 44 años, se caso hace un año pero ya vivia en unión libre con su esposo hace 26 años,  fruto de esta relación tuvieron 7 hijos de los cuales 5 ya son mayores de edad, los menores todavía estudian en el colegio. El esposo  se dedica al comercio informal.

Tiene un pequeño restaurante en su casa en el cual además de comida también vende batidos de frutas y otros productos elaborados. Trabaja todos los días en las tardes, desde las 2 pm hasta las 8 pm o hasta que se termine lo que se preparo. Trabaja con la ayuda de sus hijos menores los cuales después de hacer sus tareas le ayudan en lo necesario para dar una buena atención a los clientes.

Este crédito lo va a utilizar para comprar dos licuadoras, vasos y productos para la preparación de la comida.
Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace tiempo y esta muy contenta.
 
Sus sueños son tener un restaurante en el centro y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
The beautiful city of Portoviejo, capital city of the province of Manabi, is surrounded by marvelous beaches of warm and pleasant climate. There, the community bank named Small Businesses is located. There we spoke with Maria and she told us a little about her life. She is 44 years old and she was married last year, though she lived with the same person for 26 years. Together they had 7 children, five of whom are now independent. The youngest children are in school. Her husband is a small business owner. She has a small restaurant in a section of her home from where she sells her dishes and fruit shakes and other food products. She works every day in the afternoons, from 2pm to 8pm or until the food sells out. Her youngest children help her after they have completed their homework. They are involved in the customer service aspect of the business. This loan will be used to purchase two blenders, drinking cups, and ingredients to prepare the foods. She has been a member of this community bank for some time and she feels very happy there. Her dreams are to have a restaurant in the city's downtown and to improve their quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase two blenders, drinking cups and ingredients.

loans.name: Valentina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “Madres Trabajadoras”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Santiago, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Valentina; ella tiene 37 años de edad y es casada y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el  negocio de servicio de llamadas de teléfono en forma ambulatoria, ella trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, su esposo trabaja como chofer y juntos sacan adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere tener una cabina de teléfonos y quiere mejorar el negocio. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar celulares y pagar las líneas de teléfono. 

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This bank member belongs to the community bank "Madres Trabahadoras" (working mothers). This bank is located in the Santiago district, in the province and department of Cusco. She is Sra. Valentina. She is 37 years old and is married with two children. She alternates her daily activities with her business of offering telephone calls as a walking vendor. She works from 8:00 a.m. until 7:00 p.m. Her husband works as a driver, and together they are bringing up their children. She wants to have a shop with telephone booths and wants to improve her business. She is applying for the loan to buy cellular telephones and pay for telephone lines. She is thankful to those who are helping her create her dream through this loan, and she promises to make her payments according to the established schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cellular phones and pay for telephone lines.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou P. is from the village of Brgy. Baan, Kayapa, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 31 years old. Marilou is single. To make a living, Marilou owns & operates a general store selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Marilou has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 4,200 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Marilou joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marilou has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Marilou is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This will be the second loan taken out by Marilou from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Tol

texts.en:
Mr. Tol S. and his wife, Mrs. Saros Sen, married since 1983, have six children: four sons and two daughters. The family lives along National Road Number Six, about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Tol and his wife fish for a living from the Mekong River and the lakes near the village, selling their catches in the village market. Having received Kiva loans several times already, Tol is now requesting a new loan of $600 to purchase a boat motor.

Tol was not available for the photo, so his wife is pictured instead.

loans.use: To purchase a boat motor.

loans.name: Cissy

texts.en:
Cissy Namabiro is 21 years old and lives in the town of Natete in the Kampala west region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. Cissy has had a pharmacy business for 3 years.         

To help expand her business, Cissy has requested a loan of 250,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more medicine. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Cissy hopes to generate greater profits and buy food. In the future, Cissy hopes to own a medical home. Cissy is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by learning job skills.

loans.use: to buy more medicine.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita es socia del Banco Comunal “Brisas de Rio Blanco” ubicado en el distrito de Pilcuyo, provincia El Collao, departamento de Puno, tiene 45 años de edad, de estado civil casada, con cinco hijos y grado de instrucción de primaria incompleta.
La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace cinco años, el primer préstamo solicitado fue de S/ 500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que pudo utilizar para incrementar el capital de su negocio de engorde de toros.
Ahora solicitara un nuevo préstamo de S/ 3000.00 nuevos soles, dinero que le permitirá incrementar el capital de su negocio.
Su sueño es  tener un restaurant.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal son las charlas.
texts.en:
Margarita is a member of the “Brisas del Rio Blanco” community bank which is located in Pilcuyo district, El Collao province, Puno department.  She is 45 years old, married, and has five children.  She didn't complete her primary education.

Margarita has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for five years.  Her first loan was for 500 nuevos soles and she used that money to increase the working capital of her business fattening bulls.

She is now requesting a new loan for 3,000 nuevos soles which she will use to increase her business capital.

Her dream is to own a restaurant.

What she most likes about her community bank are the talks..

loans.use: To increase her business capital

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more crates of soft drinks, bags of rice and sacs of water

loans.name: Rebecca Wavinya

texts.en:
Rebecca is a 35-year-old single lady.  She is a mother of two children, aged 4 and 10. She lives in Wote in the Makueni district.

She sells mobile phones and accessories. This is her primary business, which she has been running for the last six years. 

She came to know about KADET LTD through a friend who was already a member.  She has never borrowed from any other financial institutions.

With this loan, she plans to add more phones and other fast moving products for sale.  

In the future, she hopes to open a cyber cafe/computer college and also to build some rental houses for added income.

loans.use: To buy mobile phones accessories (Kshs 10000), and mobile phones (Kshs 30000)

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 37-year-old single woman from Lebanon. She lives with her parents and one sibling. She helps her father assure the family has a good income. She has been growing tobacco for 15 years and in 2000, she bought land so she could produce tobacco and sell it to her own customers.

Today, she is requesting a loan of $1000 from Kiva's partner, Ameen s.a.l., to purchase needed products to make her tobacco cultivation easier and faster.

loans.use: To purchase supplies

loans.name: Harrison

texts.en: Harrison is married and has four children, all of whom attend school. He lives in a house that he rents which has electricity but not piped-in water. His greatest monthly expenses are school fees and rent. He makes a living by running a retail delivery business, distributing goods from door to door using his bicycle. He sells his services to neighbors and passersby, but faces a major challenge in the high cost of transportation. He hopes to own a wholesale shop in the future, but for now is applying for a loan for Kshs 20,000 to buy two bicycles to use to distribute goods. He joined Yehu to access loans that can improve his living standard.

loans.use: To buy two bicycles to use for distributing goods.

loans.name: Mónica Elizabeth

texts.es:
En EL Barrio Santa Clara de la ciudad de  Manta, conocido por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros y por  ser uno de los puertos más importantes del país y de América, cada 15 días se reúne el Banco Comunal Mujeres Activas.

Aquí conocimos a Mónica,  ella tiene 24 años de edad, esta  soltera y vive en casa de sus padres, en la cual vive con sus padres y una hermana menor. Esta desde el segundo ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque a través de los créditos ella ha podido sacar su negocio adelante.

Trabaja para el Gobierno Provincial, pero también se dedica al comercio vende ropa de temporada y productos Avon y Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja todos los días en sus ratos libres, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada semana o cada quince de acuerdo a lo que quieran sus clientes. Sus productos los recibe en su casa y lo que es ropa la manda a comprar a Guayaquil.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y ropa de temporada como trajes de baños, bermudas, camisetas entre otras. Sus sueños son tener una boutique.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Mujeres Activas" meets every 15 days in the Santa Clara neighborhood of the city of Manta.  This city is known for its beautiful beaches that are visited in every season of the year by national and international tourists, and for being one of the most important ports in the country and in America.

Here we meet Monica, who is 24 years old, single, and lives in her parent's house with her parents and a younger sister.  This is her 2nd loan cycle with the communal bank, and she likes it because through the loans she has managed to make progress with her business.

She works for the provincial government, but she also has a business selling seasonal clothing and Avon and Yanbal products (beauty products such as cosmetics, perfumes and accessories for women.)  She works every day in her free time, distributing her products on credit and collecting every week or 15 days, according to the wishes of her customers.  She receives her products in her house, and goes to buy the clothing in Guayaquil.

This loan is to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics and seasonal clothing such as bathing suits, shorts, T-shirts, and other items.  She dreams of someday having a boutique.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics, and seasonal clothing such as: bathing suits, T-shirts and shorts.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth M. is from the town of Bunawan. She is 48 years old. Elizabeth is married and has four children. Her eldest child is 28 years old, while the youngest is 22. To make a living, Elizabeth raises crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice and corn for sale. Elizabeth works hard to help improve her family's living conditions.

Elizabeth joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elizabeth has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Elizabeth is requesting a new loan of 10,000 Philippines pesos, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Susan Njoki

texts.en:
Susan has sold fruits and vegetables in Olkalou for the last 10 years.  She is 38 years old and the single mother of six children.  

This will be her second loan from KADET LTD.  She paid off her previous loan of Kshs 15,000 in good time. She plans to use this loan to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell.

In the future, Susan hopes to move her business into a permanent building, and she thinks this will help her sell more fruits and vegetables.

loans.use: To buy more fruits and vegatables for sell.

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is married with four children; two attend school while two are still too young for school. He has operated a restaurant business for the past three months, selling to his neighbours. He not only operates a restaurant business but also a retail shop which increases his monthly profit to meet his family demands. 

With the loan he is requesting he wants to purchase foodstuffs, wheat flour, maize flour, rice, beans and cooking fat oil. Hassan decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase foodstuffs, wheat flour, maize flour, rice, beans and cooking fat oil

loans.name: Mealii

texts.en:
Mealii is a married woman with six children -- five are attending school while one is still too young for school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past 10 years, Mealii has operated a cashew nut business, selling at the market to market dwellers. Mealii faces a major challenge of seasonality. During the rainy season, the supply for cashew nuts is lower and the demand is higher compared to the dry summer season where the supply is higher while the demand is lower. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the loan for 50,000 Kshs, Mealii  wants to start a livestock selling business, purchase livestock to resell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To start a livestcok selling business, and to purchase livestock to resell.

loans.name: Xequemeya 1 Group

texts.es:
Doña Feliza G. M., tiene 42 años D. edad, no tuvo la oportunidad D. estudiar, tiene 6 hijos los cuales no estan estudiando, se dedica a oficios domésticos y al comercio, lleva 5 años D. experiencia en la comercialzación D. ropa nueva, inició con un puesto en la calle y actualmente tiene su negocio D. reventa D. ropa en la calle, y mas adelante quiere tener con un local propio.

DeciD. orgnizar un grupo para solictar un préstamos que le servirá D. capital D. trabajo para compra D. ropa para su reventa tales como: Calcetines, bufandas, sueteres, sudadero, ropa interior, y entre otros. Las otras integrantes del grupo se dedican a la crianza D. animales y la coordinadora al comercio. Esperan con el préstamos mejoren su negocio y sus ganacias.
texts.en:
Feliza G. M. is 42 years old.  She didn't have the opportunity to go to school.  She has six children who do not attend school.  Feliza is a cleaner and also a saleswoman.  She has five years experience selling new clothes.  She started out with a street stall and currently has a business selling clothes on the street.  In the future, she would like to own her own premises.

Feliza decided to get together a group in order to request loans which would serve as working capital to buy clothes to resell such as socks, scarves, sweaters, sweatshirts, underwear, etc.  The other members of the group raise animals and the group's coordinator is a saleswoman.  They hope that their loans will enable them to improve their businesses and their profits.

loans.use: to buy clothes to resell

loans.name: C4910 Urigwiro Group

texts.en:
Jean De Dieu is 36 years old and is married with four children between the ages of 1 and 12 years old.  His business is clean and well-organized.  Jean De Dieu is a businessman selling fruits and cakes and this business is fruitful for him.

Jean De Dieu is also the leader of this group which is called Urugwiro.  The group contains one woman and five men; most of them are in the business of selling foodstuffs.  Jean De Dieu is the first person on the left side.

Jean De Dieu and his group has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand their businesses to purchase more fruit.  Once their businesses are expanded, they hope to satisfy their customers and earn more profits.

loans.use: To purchase more fruit to sell.

loans.name: Zurab

texts.en:
Zurab is a 56-year-old school teacher from village Tolebi, West Georgia. He lives with his wife Neli and his mother. Neli is a professional accountant. Along with their main professions, both of them are involved in agricultural activities. In particular, Zurab and Neli own two milk cows and sell approximately 40 kg of traditional Georgian cheese on the local market. Also the family has 1.2 ha plot where maize is grown. Each year they harvest 4 tons of grain, one of which is sold locally. The rest is used in the dairy farm. 

With part of the requested credit, Zurab will till and fertilize the land. Afterwards he will sow maize. Zurab and Neli hope that after fertilizing, they will receive approximately 5 tons of maize and sell two of them. That will increase the income of the family. The other part of the loan will be used for covering some costs related to the wedding of Zurab and Neli’s son. 

In the future Zurab and Neli plan to purchase more milk cows for expansion of the dairy farm.

loans.use: to pay for tilling service by a tractor owner, purchase fertilizers, and cover cost of wedding for his son.

loans.name: Joice

texts.en: Joice is 39 years old.  She is married and has 7 children, all of them go to school.  Joice sells charcoal.  She has borrowed a loan to stock more charcoal to sell.  She hopes to expand her business in the future with the extra profits.

loans.use: stock more charcoal to sell

loans.name: Giovana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SIEMPRE ADELANTE”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Ollantaytambo, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Giovana; ella tiene 40 años de edad y es casada y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de golosinas, ella tiene un pequeño kiosco en la estación de trenes que van al distrito de Machupicchu que queda  a 4 horas de la ciudad de Cusco ya que Machupicchu es un lugar donde numerosos de turistas llegan cada año y es muy visitado ya que es un lugar hermoso para llenarse de energia,la socia trabaja desde las 3:00 a.m hasta las 9:00 p.m y por medio de este pequeño negocio saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de golosinas. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar golosinas como galletas, dulces, chupetes y chocolates al por mayor.  
                                                       
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the Siempre Adelante (Always Moving Forward) Community Bank. The bank is located in the Ollantaytambo district in the province of Urubamba and department of Cusco.

The member is Giovana. She is 40 years old and is married with four children. The member balances her daily life with the business of selling snacks. She has a small booth in the train station. [The trains] go to the Machupicchu district and stay four hours in the city of Cusco because Machupicchu is a place where many tourists visit each year. It is very popular because it is a beautiful place for refilling one's energy. The member works from 3 am to 9 pm. In the midst of running the tiny business she cares for her children. The member wants to grow her snack sales business. The member requests this loan to purchase snacks such as crackers, sweets, lollipops, and chocolates wholesale.

The member is happy to receive this loan and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase snacks such as crackers, sweets, lollipops, and chocolates wholesale

loans.name: Amy

texts.en:
Amy is 41 years old and is a married woman with a 12-year-old child. She has been engaged in farming for 12 years. Amy primarily grows rice to sell. She earns about 10000 PHP per month from farming.

Amy has requested a loan to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. She hopes that this loan will help increase her harvest.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Ailyn

texts.en: Ailyn is 27 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. Ailyn has a pigpen that sells matured & grown pigs. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy animal feed for the pigs. Ailyn is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Ailyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy animal feed for the pigs
